characters: THE LEFT SIDE OF HIS FACE
THE BOX MOLDING IS SLIGHTLY OFF CENTER
IN THE BLACK HAWK COMMAND SHIP
U.S. ARMY WEAPONS PROTOTYPE HYDRA SERIES 6A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallen snow blankets the sprawling retreat in white. ARME MEN carrying MP-5s patrol the wooded footpaths.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER THE LEGEND
dialogues.text: In the distance, the HIGH WHINE of engines. Four SNOWMOBILES race through the drifted fields. Slalomi between the naked trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead Sno-Cat STREAKS forward. Slews to a stop at the edge of Camp David’s broad, frozen lake. The rider turns Meet MIKE BANNING. Good-looking, 30s, build of a former college athlete. Wearing the unmistakable shades and coil earpiece of the United States Secret Service. The other Sno-Cats pull up under Banning’s watchful gaze. The riders are -- BENJAMIN ASHER, a robust 50, President the United States -- MARTIN TRUMBULL, 53, the Southern-br Speaker of the House -- and MARGARET “MAGGIE” ASHER, the First Lady, a striking 42. Riding tandem with the Preside is his 6-year-old son, CONNOR.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Impressive riding, Agent Banning --

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Just leading the way, sir.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: (inhales the crisp air) We need to do this more often -- Maggie removes her helmet, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Don’t you believe him, Mike. Barely got him out here today -- it’s all work with this one. Maggie smooths stray hairs away from her face, tucks them under her knit cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Connor) How ya holdin’ up back there, partner? You an ice cube yet? Connor, face nearly blue, bravely shakes his head no. Banning reaches out, tweaks the visor of the boy’s helmet Connor beams back... hero-worship personified.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: (to Asher, only half- joking) Can’t be any colder than the reception your foreign policy initiative’s gettin’ on the Hill, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: It’s the will of the people, Marty. That’s what matters --

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Maggie’s right, Marty. Ask anyone -- (turns to Banning) Where do you stand on my platform, Mike? Off the record, of course.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Oh, I try’n leave politics to those who know it best, Mr. President. You know, the professionals... He casts a sideways look at Trumbull. Maggie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: Dodged like a true politician -- (she puts her helmet back on) Well, I don’t know about the rest of you -- but I say last one across the lake makes the hot chocolate -- Banning’s eyes shift to Asher, who nods. Banning raises h wrist mic.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Mustang -- this is Bigtop -- over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men cradling MP-5s, AGENTS ROMA and O’NEIL, stand on frozen shoreline.

dialogues.speaker: ROMA
dialogues.text: (into wrist mic) Mustang here.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Bringing home full package from Blue- Six -- repeat Blue-Six -- over. Roma raises his Steiner Marine tactical binoculars. POV ROMA: The snowmobiles idle on the far side of the lak

dialogues.speaker: ROMA
dialogues.text: Copy that, Bigtop. Have you on visual --

dialogues.speaker: BACK ACROSS THE ICE
dialogues.text: Banning turns to the others.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Everyone ready? Heads bob. Banning REVS his throttle -- and TAKES OFF.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE LAKE
dialogues.text: The agents track them through their binoculars. POV O’NEIL: The Sno-Cats TEAR ASS across the frozen lake, four abreast. Banning leads the way. O’ NEIL (shakes his head) Always the cowboy --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LAKE
dialogues.text: The snowmobiles ZOOM across the ice. Engines whining, nearly halfway home when

dialogues.speaker: SPUTTER
dialogues.text: The First Lady’s engine COUGHS.  The other snowmobiles streak ahead, racing for shore. Maggie’s engine DIES, sputtering machine skidding to a st

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHORE
dialogues.text: Banning and the others power up onto the bank. Roma and O’Neil sprint down the shoreline, pointing. Banning whirls. And sees -- MAGGIE’S SNO-CAT out on the ice. The color drains from Banning’s face. Roma and O’Neil rush up. O’ NEIL Jesus, what the --

dialogues.speaker: OUT ON THE LAKE
dialogues.text: The ice begins to SPLINTER, cracking. Maggie’s eyes are frantic, heavy machine breaking through.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SHORE
dialogues.text: Banning leaps from his Sno-Cat. Sprints across the ice.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Get off it! Get off the sled!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LAKE
dialogues.text: Maggie’s snowsuit pant loop SNAGS on the machine. She jer her leg, panicked, trying to get free. The ice fissures WIDEN. Banning races forward, stripping off his parka.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Get off it now!

dialogues.speaker: CRAAAAACK
dialogues.text: The ice CAVES IN, sucking Maggie and the Sno-Cat under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) Maggie! Asher lunges for his wife. Roma restrains him.

dialogues.speaker: ROMA
dialogues.text: Sir, no -- ! Asher jerks free and TAKES OFF RUNNING, out onto the ice. Roma and O’Neil give chase. O’ NEIL (into wrist mic) Rosebud is down! Rosebud is down! POTUS is on the ice!

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: Maggie pounds against the ice, eyes wide with terror.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LAKE
dialogues.text: Roma and O’Neil chase after Asher. Alarm klaxons WAIL alo the shoreline as

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: races forward at a DEAD RUN. Sprinting all out. He reache the jagged hole in the ice and

dialogues.speaker: DIVES
dialogues.text: into the freezing water.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE ICE
dialogues.text: Silent, cold, dark. Banning swims down. Eyes darting, desperately searching. And in the dimness below...

dialogues.speaker: MAGGIE
dialogues.text: stares up at him, hair streaming behind her. Floating awa into the frozen depths. Banning struggles down to her. Face contorted in pain. He’s out of air.  He keeps diving. A superhuman effort. His hand reaches out and GRABS MAGGIE’S ARM Banning pulls her toward the surface. Dim light flickerin through the frozen ice above. He reaches for his shoulder holster and

dialogues.speaker: DRAWS HIS SIG SAUER P229
dialogues.text: Banning aims the gun straight up. What is he doing -- ?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LAKE
dialogues.text: Gun blasts blow a GAPING HOLE in the frozen ice. Banning BURSTS from below. Roma and O’Neil race up. Pull Maggie from the frigid water. They lay her on the ice. Eyes rolled back, unmoving. O0/’ desperately administers CPR.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: No, God! No! Asher drops to his knees. Nearly delirious with disbelief and fear. O’Neil frantically tries to revive her. Banning can only stare, trembling in the bitter cold.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom? Banning turns. Connor stares at him, lower lip quivering. The boy’s face frozen in a rictus of horror. Asher grabs his son in his arms. The President and Bannin lock eyes. Banning lowers his gaze. As overhead, the POUNDING ROTORS of the descending RESCUE CHOPPER whirl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: A spinning RAZOR SCOOTER WHEEL.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: Wearing a crash helmet, Connor, now 8, zooms through the halls of the White House on his Razor Scooter.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER THE LEGEND
dialogues.text: POV MOVING FAST -- Ducking and darting with practiced ski Connor expertly weaves through the corridors and passagew of the Ground Floor. The kid obviously knows the Executive Mansion cold. Connor speeds down the Center Hall, past a RECEPTIONIST a her desk. Busy on the phone, she smiles at Connor as he passes. Connor waves back. Connor zooms into the WHITE HOUSE KITCHEN.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: An unsmiling PASTRY CHEF meticulously ices a tray of PETI FOURS. The LOCAL NEWS plays on a small counter TV.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSMAN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: -- with highs today pushing 100 in what promises to be a real scorcher of a July Fourth for the entire greater D.C. area -- Connor speeds past -- hand furtively reaching for a mini- éclair --

dialogues.speaker: PASTRY CHEF
dialogues.text: (French accent) Connor! Pas encore! The boy jerks his hand back, keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: (calling back over his shoulder) Je suis désolé! Connor zooms from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor ducks and weaves down the corridor. As up ahead, through an open door we see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banks of MONITORS manned by keen-eyed TECHNICIANS. Standing by the door, the HEAD TECHNICIAN pulls the last CHOCOLATE CHIP MUFFIN from a white box and sets it ona napkin. The LOCAL NEWS, playing on a small monitor screen grabs his attention. ON MONITOR SCREEN: NEWS FOOTAGE of North Korean ARMED FOR massing along the DMZ. The banner headline reads: “NORTH KOREAN BUILDUP CONTINUES TO SPARK FEARS”.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSMAN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: -- ongoing massive North Korean war games along the 38th Parallel continue to send shock waves throughout South Korea, prompting this morning’s emergency meeting between President Asher and South Korean Foreign Minister Lee Tae- Woo -- The head technician turns for his muffin... it’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Connor zooms down the corridor. Takes a BIG BITE of the chocolate chip muffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carver Langston section of town. Tired-looking brick rowhomes line the street. The dome of the Capitol rises distantly in the morning haze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dim bedroom. The battered window air conditioner RATTLE water steadily dripping into the almost-full BUCKET under A phone on the nightstand RINGS, JARRING. Keeps RINGING.  A HAND slowly reaches from beneath the covers. Picks up.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (groggy) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Did I wake you? Banning sits up. Rubs a hand across his tired face.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: No. He reaches for the remote and flicks on the TV. The local news plays, low.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Gonna make it over for dinner Sunday?

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (beat) Uh -- I don’t know yet -- Banning’s eyes flick to the TV. BANNING (cont’ d) -- let me think about it -- An awkward silence on the line.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSMAN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: -- Seoul continues to be in a state of crisis following the sweeping U.S. troop withdrawals central to the Asher administration’s increasingly controversial foreign policy platform --

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: (hesitant) I saw Kristen yesterday...

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Yeah? ON TV: Asher addresses the media from the White House Ros Garden. Flanked by his SECRET SERVICE protection detail.  10.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: I appreciate my critics’ position. But this administration marks the end of America’s decades-long pattern of global intervention --

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: .»..she got engaged... A flicker of emotion crosses Banning’s face.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (covering) Good for her.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: -- the United States will no longer be the world’s policeman. Banning’s eyes stay fixed on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I just... I didn’t want you to hear it from someone else -- ON TV: The Secret Service briskly escorts Asher from the podium.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: I gotta get to work -- He hangs up. Clicks off the TV. The water from the air conditioner continues to DRIP. Banning gets out of bed, absently pushes aside the overfl bucket with his foot. Slides a dented WASTEBASKET over to take its place. Shoulders slumped, he pads into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning exits, wearing the white short-sleeved uniform sh black pants, and gold badge of the Secret Service UNIFORM DIVISION. He looks one step up from a Rent-A-Cop. He slides into his beat-up Dodge Ram pickup and pulls fro the curb.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chanting PROTESTERS march outside the gate, waving signs reading “IMPEACH ASHER!”, “DON’T LEAVE SOUTH KOREA DEFENSELESS!”, “FREEDOM THROUGH STRENGTH!”, etc. The WHITE HOUSE itself rises majestically from the emeral South Lawn. Secret Service SNIPERS on the roof, K-9 PATRO circling the grounds, armed GUARDS at every entrance. The most protected building on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Asher holds a tense meeting with his inner circ Including Speaker of the House Trumbull, they are: 1) LUIS CARDOZA, Hispanic, the Vice President 2) RUTH McMILLAN, tough, unsmiling, the Secretary of Defe 3) ADMIRAL NATHAN HOENIG, bald, Chairman of the Joint Chi

dialogues.speaker: HOENIG
dialogues.text: Lee’s gonna want you to reconsider, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Nate, you know damn well it’s the nukes of the Seventh Fleet keeping the peace over there, not our boots on the ground --

dialogues.speaker: MCMILLAN
dialogues.text: But those troops served as the trip wire, sir. And the South Koreans know that.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: That’s why the Fleet stays. Cardoza rallies behind the President.

dialogues.speaker: CARDOZA
dialogues.text: And the three billion saved from this move alone will fund over 100 new schools, not to mention --  12.

dialogues.speaker: HOENIG
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) South Korea doesn’t give a shit about any of that -- they’ve got the whole goddamn North Korean Army ready to pour across their border!

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: That’s not going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: MCMILLAN
dialogues.text: Can you guarantee that? Asher sighs, rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Marty, you've been awfully quiet --

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: Minister Lee knows we’1ll stand by him, Mr. President. He needs reassurance, that’s all. (beat) Give it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A private airstrip in the middle of nowhere. An unmarked C-130 CARGO PLANE idles on the grassy runway. Four Allison T56 turboprops THROBBING. Two buzzcut, military-looking NORTH KOREANS in flight sui race up the rear ramp, pulling on flight helmets. With a mechanical WHINE, the ramp door closes.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: The North Korean PILOT and CO-PILOT finish their pre-flig

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: (in Korean, subtitled) Wheels up. He throws the throttle forward.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE RUNWAY
dialogues.text: The lumbering plane ROARS down the runway, and lifts into cloudless blue sky. And we see...  13. Eerily, left behind on the airstrip, a SMALL TABLE covere a white tablecloth. Bottle of soju (Korean distilled alcohol) and four ceremonial cups atop it. The tablecloth flutters gently in the breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An anonymous, 9-story tan brick building on H Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispiritedly sipping coffee, Banning checks IDs inside th main entrance. His face is rote, expressionless. It’s soul-crushingly boring, but hey, at least the A/C’s crank A fellow officer, HUTCHINS, 30s, strides up.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: Banning -- Lieutenant says there’s a problem in Sector 14. Water Authority has to check it out -- Banning takes a final gulp of coffee, stands.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (resigned) I’m on it -- He heads for the door. Hutchins takes over his post.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Stay cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor brakes to a SKIDDING STOP on his scooter at the en a long corridor. At the far end of the hall, he sees his father and the others exit the Cabinet Room.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CABINET ROOM
dialogues.text: Meeting adjourned, Asher pulls Trumbull aside.  14.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Thanks for sitting in, Marty. I want you to know your support has been invaluable.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: (nods) Just tell me something, Ben -- Asher waits, expectant. TRUMBULL (cont’d) Are you sure about all this?

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: I made a promise to the people. And I intend to keep it. Trumbull shakes Asher’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: Have a good meeting with the Minister.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: I will. And you have a Happy 4th. Trumbull smiles, exits through a side door. Asher turns a disappears back into the Cabinet Room -- not seeing his s at the far end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH CONNOR
dialogues.text: Who watches his father go. Face unreadable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Head Technician peers at a closed-circuit monitor. CLOSE ON MONITOR: The South Korean motorcade pulls beneat the North Portico.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Our guests have arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trumbull exits through the Pennsylvania Avenue guardhouse Glances at the arriving motorcade as he slides into his waiting Town Car.  15.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE NORTH PORTICO
dialogues.text: The doors of the motorcade open, and South Korean Foreign Minister LEE TAE-WOO, 50s, dignified, emerges behind a phalanx of BODYGUARDS. An impeccably dressed MAN in wire-rimmed glasses, mid 30s steps out behind Lee. Unassuming, reserved accountant’s demeanor, but eyes missing nothing. This is KANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Roma (recognizable from the Camp David opening) -- Special Agent In Charge of the White House Secret Service detail -- greets Lee at the door.

dialogues.speaker: ROMA
dialogues.text: Foreign Minister Lee -- I’m Special Agent in Charge Roma. Welcome to the White House.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Agent Roma. May I introduce my head of security and chief aide, Mr. Kang -- Kang bows, formal. Roma nods back. Only Lee, Kang, and the Minister’s personal security deta PAK, LIM (female), CHO and YU -- are permitted inside. Al surrender their weapons to the Secret Service. Roma scrutinizes Lee’s delegation as they pass through th White House MILLIMETER-WAVE SCANNER. Each guest walks through the large portal -- 9 feet tall 6 feet wide -- pauses and lifts their arms while the mach takes TWO FULL-BODY SCANS using radio waves. A male TECHNICIAN watches the black-and-white images on h computer screen. [NOTE: The images are detailed enough to see the sweat on a person’s back.] Lim (wearing a trim blue suit, strand of pearls) hesitate before entering the machine. She shoots Roma a look, pointed.  16. Roma nods, and a FEMALE TECHNICIAN sits down to review Li screen image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The South Korean motorcade exits the drive, and parks alo the protected stretch of Pennsylvania Avenue in front of White House. DIPLOMATIC SECURITY (DS) AGENTS establish a secure perimeter around the vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot and co-pilot stare straight ahead, faces expressionless. POV THROUGH WINDSCREEN: In the far distance, the city of Washington D.C. rises in the morning haze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand yards across the Mall from the White House, a SERVICE RANGER stands outside a cordoned area on the bank the Tidal Basin. Behind the yellow caution tape, WORKERS erect firing platforms for this evening’s holiday firewor display. Banning pulls up in a white Secret Service SUV. The Range waves him through. Banning parks the vehicle, gets out, a crosses to a pair of D.C. Water and Sewer workmen (TATE, ORTIZ) standing over a manhole.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Hey guys, what’s up?

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Fireworks techs say they’re getting steam venting all up and down the line --

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Not surprised -- most of the pipes under here gotta be almost 80 years old -- Banning wipes the sweat from his face, humidity hanging l a shroud.  17.

dialogues.speaker: TATE
dialogues.text: (jerks a thumb) Well, see that? That’s 20,000 pounds of pyrotechnic explosive, Cochise. Let’s just say it’s makin’ ‘em nervous.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Can’t say I blame ‘em. Ortiz gestures to the closed manhole cover.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Tried liftin’ that sucker myself, but the bitch won’t budge -- Banning conjures a MASTER KEY from his belt key chain.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Need the keys to the kingdom. Banning unlocks the manhole cover and lifts.

dialogues.speaker: TATE
dialogues.text: You go, Sixto.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: TATE
dialogues.text: Dude, I went last time -- Ortiz scowls, grabs his toolbox. Banning follows him down the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: ...puta madre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortiz’s flashlight plays over the twisting maze of pipes. Steam HISSES ominously in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Vacuum breakers are shot. Foulin’ up all the feeds... Banning trails Ortiz down the dark tunnel. His face twist the stench down here is overpowering.  18.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Jesus --

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: You're tellin’ me -- (continues on) -- holiday pay’s not enough for this shit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Asher moves down the hall with Cardoza, McMilla and Hoenig. Pushes open an inner door, and steps into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Oval Office. Foreign Minister Lee stands. As does the rest of Asher’s entire assembled NATIONAL SECURITY TEAM.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Minister Lee, it’s good to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. President. I appreciate you taking the time to meet on your nation’s holiday.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Shall we sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corridor outside, Roma stands across from Kang. Th two professionals share an amicable look. Roma moves closer, admires the LAPEL PIN embossed with th South Korean flag affixed to Kang’s suit. It’s round, slightly larger than the American flag pin on Roma’s own lapel.

dialogues.speaker: ROMA
dialogues.text: Snazzy --

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Thank you, Agent Roma.  19. Kang bows again, polite. When suddenly

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: zooms around the corner on his Razor Scooter. He BRAKES t stop, just short of the two security men.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: (to Roma) Can I see my dad?

dialogues.speaker: ROMA
dialogues.text: Sorry, he’s in a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: A long one? Roma shrugs, sympathetic. Connor’s eyes shift to Kang. Kang imperceptibly nods back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning restlessly fidgets while Ortiz works.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: So who’d you piss off, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Hadda do something -- to be the one sent down here -- Banning shrugs, noncommittal. ORTIZ (cont’d) -- thought you guys all flew around on Air Force One and shit -- Behind them, a low stealthy rustling. Ortiz swings his li down the tunnel and

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE HAIRY RAT
dialogues.text: crouches in the darkness. Eyes reflecting back red.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Freakin’ Willard, man!  20.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: You ain’t kiddin’ --

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: Hey -- wanna see somethin’ ? Ortiz pulls a piece of BEEF JERKY from his pocket, tosses down the pipe. The rat crawls forward, nose twitching. ORTIZ (cont’d) C’mon, you ugly mother -- The rat crawls closer. Ortiz leans forward, face expectan ORTIZ (cont’d) Hear that? A telltale HISS emits from a recessed vent. The huge rat waddles forward when suddenly

dialogues.speaker: A MASSIVE BLAST OF STEAM
dialogues.text: ERUPTS from the wall vent -- nearly fricasseeing the rat. scampers away into the darkness, squealing.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: (cackling) Take that, you lice-covered freak! Ortiz turns back to Banning. ORTIZ (cont’d) (eager) Wanna fry another one? Banning’s look says it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C-130 cargo plane arrows toward Washington.

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Unidentified aircraft, heading six- zero-niner, this is PPD Command. Be advised, you have entered restricted airspace --  21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RADAR OPERATOR stares into her glowing screen.

dialogues.speaker: RADAR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Repeat, unidentified aircraft, you have strayed into restricted airspace. This is a no-fly zone. You must divert immediately --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C-130 continues toward the heart of Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roma bursts into Asher’s meeting.

dialogues.speaker: ROMA
dialogues.text: Mr. President, we have an airspace incursion, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two F-22 Raptor FIGHTER-INTERCEPTORS streak in. Take up flanking positions alongside the lumbering C-130.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Raptor PILOT peers through his canopy bubble.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Unidentified flight, Echo-Victor- Foxtrot, this is flight leader U.S. Navy aircraft on your starboard wing. You have entered restricted airspace. You are to divert immediately, vector heading zero-two-zero. Acknowledge. No response. PILOT (cont’d) Unidentified flight, you must divert immediately to vector zero- two-zero. This is your final warning. Acknowledge.  22. The pilot flips a switch, ARMING the F-22’s weapons syste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, the C-130’s SIDE DOORS simultaneously WH OPEN, revealing --

dialogues.speaker: THE LETHAL MUZZLES
dialogues.text: of two M61 VULCAN ROTARY CANNONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot’s face goes white.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Fuck -- He jerks his stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late. The twin guns OPEN FIRE WITH A BUZZSAW ROAR. Bo F-22s are instantly BLOWN OUT OF THE SKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roma’s earpiece crackles.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Code Halo! Repeat, Code Halo! The Secret Service leaps into action. Four agents literal pick up President Asher, rush him from the Oval Office.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The agents race Asher down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Connor -- it’s okay --  23. Roma grabs Connor. Carrying the boy, he follows the President, the National Security Team, and Lee’s delegati down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarm klaxons WAILING, the White House evacuates. Skeleto holiday staff racing for the exits. Roma herds President Asher’s group inside the EMERGENCY ELEVATOR. Hands Connor off to a TALL AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: ROMA
dialogues.text: Take him! The Tall Agent nods. The heavy steel doors CLOSE. Roma stays behind, weapon drawn. Rushes back down the corridor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A final scrambled F-22 SCREAMS down the runway, into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cargo plane passes low over Roosevelt Island. The C-130’s modified CARGO BAY DOORS suddenly open with a mechanical WHINE and

dialogues.speaker: A CIRCULAR ROTODOME
dialogues.text: lowers from the plane. Smooth, round, 3 meters across. Ma of white polycarbonate. It looks like a smaller version o the radar housing on the back of an AWACS plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.C. POLICE on the street draw their weapons -- rooftop SNIPERS peer through their scopes -- MARINES atop buildin swing Stinger missiles to their shoulders. Locked. Loaded. Ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emergency elevator doors open. The Secret Service rus Asher and the others down the long corridor.

dialogues.speaker: TALL AGENT
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortiz’s radio squawks.

dialogues.speaker: TATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Ortiz! Get the hell up here! Ortiz scrambles for the manhole ladder. Banning follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C-130 pilot speaks into his mic.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: (in Korean, subtitled) Goggles down. The pilot, co-pilot, and door gunners flip down protectiv visors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortiz vaults from the open manhole. Tate points to the sky, hand shaking. Ortiz spins and see

dialogues.speaker: THE CARGO PLANE
dialogues.text: skim low over the Lincoln Memorial. Barely clearing the monument’s roof.

dialogues.speaker: ORTIZ
dialogues.text: What the -- The Park Ranger comes running, gun pointed skyward.  25.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MALL
dialogues.text: PEDESTRIANS stare up in fear and dismay. TOURISTS on the Mall snap pictures, run for cover. The defenders ready to OPEN FIRE. They’re going to blow t plane out of the fucking sky when --

dialogues.speaker: THE ROTODOME
dialogues.text: hanging from the C-130’s underbelly suddenly SCREAMS TO L fires a massive LIGHT PULSE. The invisible pulse radiates every direction -- like an EMP burst --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MALL
dialogues.text: Everyone on the ground is INSTANTLY BLINDED. Cameras, rad laser targeting systems, all are incapacitated. POV ORTIZ: He stares up at the plane -- AND HIS WHOLE WOR

dialogues.speaker: GOES WHITE
dialogues.text: The Park Ranger and other blinded defenders FIRE WILDLY. Able only to HEAR their target passing overhead. Two Stingers SCREAM from their launchers but miss their mark.

dialogues.speaker: THE C-130
dialogues.text: ROARS down the National Mall, over the Reflecting Pool. Straight for the Capitol. The cargo plane takes MULTIPLE HITS, but doesn’t slow. Do gunners POURING FIRE with their Vulcans on the blinded defenders below.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MALL
dialogues.text: Helpless defenders are BLOWN OFF rooftops, RIDDLED on the street. Crumpling to the ground like broken dolls.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: leaps from the open manhole. Sees the Park Ranger, Tate a Ortiz, all clutching their eyes. He draws his Sig Sauer P229. RAPID-FIRES at the lumbering plane above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hail of INCENDIARY SLUGS digs across the turf. The Rang and both workmen are CUT TO PIECES. Banning dives away, rolling as

dialogues.speaker: HIS SECRET SERVICE SUV
dialogues.text: is raked by gunfire. It EXPLODES -- whole truck somersaul into the air -- CRASHING to earth, flames spewing -- The cargo plane suddenly BANKS overhead... Headed directly for the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C-130 comes in low, over the Ellipse. Uniformed Divis SECRET SERVICE rush from the White House, firing.

dialogues.speaker: THE ROTODOME
dialogues.text: fires another LIGHT PULSE. Incapacitating everyone.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE MALL
dialogues.text: Banning’s face twists, blinded.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP THE WHITE HOUSE
dialogues.text: On the White House roof, the massive Avenger antiaircraft missile pods swivel. Computerized targeting useless. The SECRET SERVICE GUNNER aims blindly. He thumbs the firing button. WHOOSH! The SAM missiles scream from their tubes -- One missile BLASTS THE CARGO PLANE’S TAIL RUDDER IN HALF! The others all miss.

dialogues.speaker: THE C-130 DOOR GUNNERS
dialogues.text: BLAZE AWAY on their Vulcans. The Avenger is OBLITERATED. SECRET SERVICE SNIPERS on the roof -- D.C. POLICE and MAR GUARDS on the South Lawn -- open up blindly with everythi they have. Glocks, MP-5s, M-4 rifles -- All are mowed down.  27.

dialogues.speaker: SOUTH OF THE MALL
dialogues.text: The final scrambled F-22 fighter SCREAMS IN LOW over the Potomac. Afterburners hot.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE F-22
dialogues.text: The F-22 PILOT thumbs his mic.

dialogues.speaker: F-22 PILOT
dialogues.text: PPD Command, this is Wolfhound 6 -- have bogey in sight --

dialogues.speaker: PPD COMMAND, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Wolfhound 6, fire at will, repeat, fire at will. The pilot gets missile lock. Finger on the firing button.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE C-130
dialogues.text: The rotodome SCREAMS TO LIFE. Fires a final LIGHT PULSE.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE F-22
dialogues.text: POV PILOT: EVERYTHING GOES STARK WHITE. Targeting systems knocked out. Valiant, he blindly unleashes his air-to-air Sidewinder missiles. 20mm cannon BELCHING FLAME. Three of the four Sidewinders DETONATE into the side of t Washington Monument. The fourth SCREAMS past, barely miss by a foot. The F-22 SLAMS straight into the obelisk, BLOWING THE MAS MONUMENT IN HALF. The top half CRASHES TO THE GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: THE C-130
dialogues.text: ROARS over the Ellipse. Path clear to the White House whe

dialogues.speaker: THE FOURTH MISSILE
dialogues.text: SLAMS into the C-130 cockpit. The cargo plane EXPLODES, crashing to earth in a SPECTACULAR FIREBALL mere yards sh of the White House South Lawn.  28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher’s group arrives at the President’s Emergency Operat Center (PEOC) bunker. The nineteen-inch-thick titanium do opens. The Tall Agent’s earpiece buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) All units, this is Command. Bogey is down. Repeat, bogey is down.

dialogues.speaker: TALL AGENT
dialogues.text: Command, this is Watchtower One. Confirm that last. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICE, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Watchtower One. Confirm received. Bogey destroyed. Everyone can finally breathe. The agent releases Connor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallen BODIES lie everywhere. The White House outer defen have been DECIMATED by the attack. Surviving defenders though disoriented, slowly regaining their sight. But the Executive Mansion still stands.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE MALL
dialogues.text: Banning gets to his feet, blinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the doors of the South Korean motorcade BURST O Black-clad COMMANDOS in full body armor leap out. RIDDLE surprised DS agents in the street. Rocket-propelled grenades EXPLODE, blowing gaping holes i the White House fence. The South Korean SUVs jump the sidewalk, PLOWING through the fence onto the North Lawn. Secret Service rockets EXPLODE harmlessly off the SUVs’ armor-plated sides.  29. Smoke grenades are RAPID-FIRED, obscuring everything in billowing CLOUDS OF GRAY. The commandos stream across the lawn, thermal-imaging goggles over their masks. POV COMMANDOS: The heat signatures of the White House defenders glow ORANGE-RED in the haze. Secret Service and D.C. Police are CUT DOWN where they st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall Agent’s earpiece erupts in frantic, static-ridde crosstalk.

dialogues.speaker: RADIO VOICES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) They’ re swarming my sector! Shit, they’ re everywhere... !

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: What’s going on?! Down the hall, Lim’s hand slips behind her neck. Unclasps her STRAND OF PEARLS. With a glance to Kang, she leans around the corner. Flick her wrist, and the small spheres FLY from the strand. Bou down the hall, rolling among the President’s men. ASHER (cont’d) Connor! Where’s Conn--

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The flash-bang grenades EXPLODE. A blinding, incapacitati blast. Kang’s security men burst from around the corner. Whip of their round LAPEL PINS. Razor sharp spring-loaded BLADES flick out. SHURIKEN. The throwing stars whistle. Secret Service agents drop as pole-axed. Kang plants his shuriken between the Tall Agen eyes. Connor spins and runs. Kang sees him disappear around the corner. Kang shoots Yu a look. Yu rushes after the boy.  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUVs ROAR across the lawn, slewing before the North Porti A commando leaps out, shoulders a LAW anti-tank missile. He FIRES. The steel White House doors disappear in a SEARING BLAST. An SUV CRASHES through the gaping hole, whole truck just PLOWING STRAIGHT INTO THE ENTRANCE HALL of the Executive Mansion. Commandos leap into the breach. Roma rallies the defenders. The Secret Service RETURN FIR from the grand staircase of the nation’s most famous home A furious, pitched battle inside the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang and his team grab the Secret Service weapons, herd President Asher, Minister Lee, and the entire National Security Team (eleven hostages total) inside the PEOC. INT. PRESIDENT’S EMERGENCY OPERATIONS CENTER (PEOC) -

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: A large, well-lit room. Hermetically-sealed, waterproof, soundproof, direct-hit-from-a-nuclear-bombproof. A massiv WALLSCREEN and COMPUTER CONSOLE dominates everything. The disoriented hostages are hustled inside. Hands quickl and expertly zipcuffed. Lim sits before the computer console, fingers flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Warning lights blink, monitor screens locking.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: We’re being shut down! A commando barges in, BLOWING EVERYONE AWAY.  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sight slowly returning, Banning watches helplessly as the smoke swirls and gunfire ECHOES. Face a mask of anguish, battles the suicidal urge to rush blindly into the fray. Working quickly, Banning reloads his weapon. Spins and descends into the open manhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning clicks his flashlight ON. The beam flickers into darkness ahead. Moving fast, Banning disappears down the pitch black tunn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor flees. Races around the corner, almost falling. Ducks into the laundry room. Yu rapidly closes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunshots ECHOING, the battle descends into the bowels of White House. The Secret Service, outmanned and outgunned, fight a hopeless rear guard action. There is no escape. Roma and the last few agents are SHOT LIKE DOGS in the lo basement hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yu enters the large industrial laundry room. Huge commerc WASHER/DRYERS line the wall. A half dozen rolling LINEN CARTS. Yu violently UPENDS the carts. RIPS OPEN the washer/dryer doors, moving down the line. The kid’s just... gone. Yu slams the wall in frustration. Exits the laundry room.  32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning arrives at a terminus of water mains. A series of encrusted circular hatches, shoulder high. He looks up, orienting himself to the ground above. Quick he moves to the far pipe. Pries at the corroded valve -- thick with decades of rust and slime. It finally opens wi a rending SQUEAL. Banning peers inside. A long, long pipe. Barely three feet wide, pitch black. A claustrophobe’s nightmare. Banning hoists himself up, squeezing in. Crawls forward i the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mortally wounded, Roma lies crumpled against the wall. Weakly, he calls into his wrist mic.

dialogues.speaker: ROMA
dialogues.text: Olympus Has Fallen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret Service Command receives the halting transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roma coughs, spitting blood.

dialogues.speaker: ROMA
dialogues.text: ...Olympus Has Fallen. A commando looms over him, razored throwing star in hand. Roma looks up. The shuriken flashes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Command Post RADIOMAN blinks in stunned disbelief.  33.

dialogues.speaker: RADIOMAN
dialogues.text: (face white) They’ ve taken the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nightmare tableaux of unfathomable devastation. The Washington Monument is a BROKEN RUIN. Fallen Secret Service and Marine guards LITTER the White House grounds. Drifting smoke casts an EERIE PALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And impossibly, on the White House roof, a commando RIPS Stars and Stripes from its lanyard -- And throws it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning crawls forward. Face blackened, filthy. He peers into the darkness ahead and

dialogues.speaker: A SILVER FLOOD-HATCH
dialogues.text: bars his way. The polished metal gleams, wildly incongruo in the ancient corroded pipe. Banning scrapes away at the grime-encrusted wall -- revea an ELECTRO-MECHANICAL HIGH-SECURITY LOCK. Working quickly he pulls the MASTER KEY from his belt key chain. Inserts key and turns -- A green LED illuminates -- and a recessed wall panel SLID BACK -- revealing a glowing digital CONTROL PANEL. Bannin punches a numeric code into the keypad.

dialogues.speaker: ROBOT VOICE
dialogues.text: Authenticate.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Echelon 4.

dialogues.speaker: ROBOT VOICE
dialogues.text: Designator.  34.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Oscar-Zulu, three-zero-niner. The silver flood-hatch IRISES OPEN. A brightly-lit STAINLESS STEEL AQUEDUCT unfolds before hi Shining, pristine. Like some kind of futuristic tube to t underworld. Banning quickly crawls forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lim looks up at Kang from the computer console.

dialogues.speaker: LIM
dialogues.text: Control override complete. White House systems secured. All outside networks locked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning crawls forward when suddenly -- ALL THE LIGHTS GO Pitch blackness. He blinks in the darkness when

dialogues.speaker: ZZZZZUMP
dialogues.text: MOTION DETECTOR BEAMS appear, crisscrossing the tube ahea At two-foot intervals for the next fifteen yards. There’s no way past.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Shit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commandos from the upstairs ground assault enter the PEOC Deliver to Kang a STAINLESS STEEL BRIEFCASE. Yu returns to the bunker. He crosses to Kang, whispers lo in his ear. Kang slowly removes his glasses, meticulously folds them. Then -- quick as a cobra -- he spins on Yu and instantly SNAPS HIS NECK.  35. The hostages SCREAM. Kang coolly turns to Pak. A muscular automaton.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Get the boy. Asher leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Stay away from my son! Kang turns to Asher, face serenely calm.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: You’re in no position to demand anything. A commando levels his weapon at Asher’s chest. KANG (cont’d) Sit down. Beat. The President reluctantly sits. Kang turns away, nods to Pak. Pak exits. The bunker SEALS SHUT behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning is stymied by the motion detector beams barring h path. He can’t move forward -- Then, faraway, a distant sound. Quickly, it grows LOUDER. Coming closer now, like a runaway train --

dialogues.speaker: THE BEAMS WINK OUT
dialogues.text: Banning’s eyes grow wide as

dialogues.speaker: AN AVALANCHE OF WATER
dialogues.text: CRASHES toward him through the pipe. Banning sucks in short, rapid breaths. Urgently filling h lungs as

dialogues.speaker: THE ROARING TORRENT
dialogues.text: engulfs him. His gun and flashlight are torn from his gra  36. Banning hangs on against the enormous pressure. Straining lungs screaming for air when

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER SUBSIDES
dialogues.text: Banning GASPS for breath. Frantic, he rapidly drags himse forward through the pipe, hand over hand. Panic etching his face as

dialogues.speaker: ZZZZZUMP
dialogues.text: The motion detector beams STAB DOWN AGAIN. Banning glances back -- and sees the final motion detecto beam a HALF-INCH behind the sole of his left shoe. Relieved, he continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang calmly steps to the head of the presidential bunker he owns the building. And, indeed, he does.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: I don’t know who the hell you are -- Kang regards Asher evenly.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: I’m the man who’s just taken the most secure building on Earth. Asher’s gaze nervously flicks to his MILITARY AIDE nearby black BRIEFCASE attached via security cable to his wrist. The NUCLEAR FOOTBALL. KANG (cont’d) (knowing) I’m not interested in your launch codes, Mr. President. Which by now I’m sure your Pentagon has changed... Minister Lee stares, stunned by Kang’s betrayal.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  37.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Open your eyes, Minister Lee. Our homeland is divided. Our people are divided. Because of these Americans...

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: (falters) But -- our countries were working toward peace -- Kang begins to walk slowly toward Lee.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Does your “peace” involve millions of our Northern brothers, dead from famine and disease? (he draws closer) Our families separated by tanks and guns and American mines? Kang stands before Lee. KANG (cont’d) No, Minister Lee, this is war. (beat) The time has come for all Korea to again be one. Lee holds Kang’s gaze.

dialogues.speaker: LEE
dialogues.text: You're a traitor. Kang slowly leans forward, face barely an inch from the Minister’s. We just saw what happened to the last person Kang got thi close to. A bead of sweat slides down Lee’s temple.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: (evenly) I’m a patriot. Kang turns and walks away. Lee can breathe again.  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The National Military Command Center (aka Crisis Room) of Pentagon. A cavernous space, massive conference table the size of an aircraft carrier. Trumbull strides in, flanked by Homeland Security agents. RAJIV MALIK, 45, Deputy Director of the National Security Agency, steps forward. A lanky, almost gaunt man. Dark ey hiding a formidable intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: Speaker Trumbull. Rajiv Malik, NSA. Since the attack, we’ve had no contact with the White House --

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: No, sir. They share a look. On the massive wallscreen, a breaking LIVE NEWS BROADCAST.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: ...the whereabouts of President Benjamin Asher -- if indeed, he is still alive -- are not known at this time... (dramatic beat) For the first time in two hundred years, when the British burned the “President’s House”, as it was then known, during the War of 1812, a foreign enemy occupies the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning continues to crawl forward. His rasping breaths E in the pitch-black pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Secret Service Director, LYNNE JACOBS, late 40s, Afri American, strides up to Trumbull and Malik.  39.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: Speaker Trumbull, the White House perimeter has been secured, sir. But all communications with Olympus are still severed.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: (low) What a disaster -- Across the room, KANG’S FACE suddenly appears on the enor wallscreen.

dialogues.speaker: KANG, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Mr. Trumbull. The whole room jumps. Kang’s eyes fix on Trumbull. Trumbu blinks, taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang stands before the massive PEOC control console.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: My name is Yeonsak Kang. The man who now controls your White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whirlwind of emotion sweeps the Crisis Room.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: Let me speak to the President. Asher is hauled forward at gunpoint. TRUMBULL (cont’d) Sir, are you all right? Before Asher can say anything, he’s jerked away.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: In addition to your President, I hold your Vice President, full National Security Team, and South Korean Foreign Minister Lee inside the President’s Emergency Operations Center -- Kang’s looming face remains inscrutable.  40. KANG (cont’d) I understand it’s impregnable. Trumbull swallows.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: I want you to recall the U.S. Seventh Fleet from the Sea of Japan.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. We can’t just -- In one smooth motion, Kang turns and SHOOTS Foreign Minis Lee through the head. The hostages recoil, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: You have 12 hours. The wallscreen GOES DARK. Everyone in the Crisis Room sta in shock. A long beat. GENERAL EDWARD GALDARRES, 50s, the Army Chief of Staff, t to Trumbull.

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: If we recall the Fleet -- and the North attacks -- Seoul and the whole of South Korea could fall within seventy-two hours. Trumbull falters, stunned. GALDARRES (cont’d) Our only recourse would be our long-range ICBMs --

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: -- which no doubt would bring in the Chinese first, then the Russians -- (beat) -- goddamn nuclear holocaust --  41. They all trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: But if we don’t recall the Fleet, they kill the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruised and exhausted, Banning reaches the end of the pip A steel ACCESS DOOR looms before him. Banning pulls out his master key. He stops short, thinkin Then -- working fast -- he unscrews the end of the master key. A specially-designed BUMPER KEY slides out. Banning slips the mechanical-only key into the keyway. Presses a button on the key which causes it to VIBRATE fo few seconds. EXTREME CLOSE-UP: Inside the lock, the mechanical motor i the cylinder turns, lifting the locking element within -- bypassing the electronic portion of the lock and thwartin audit logs -- and the lock RELEASES. The access door OPENS -- and Banning’s eyes ZOOM to the L indicator light. It remains dark. He exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning drops into a sub-basement corridor. Cautiously mo down the hallway. He turns the corner and

dialogues.speaker: A VIDEO CAMERA
dialogues.text: swings his way in a whir of servos. Banning shrinks back. Moves quickly in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang crosses to Secretary of Defense McMillan. She looks eyes afraid.  42.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: (without preamble) Give me your Cerberus code. McMillan blinks. Asher and Hoenig exchange a stunned look How the hell does Kang know about Cerberus?

dialogues.speaker: MCMILLAN
dialogues.text: I -- I have no such code -- Kang opens the stainless steel briefcase. Inside the foam lined case is a large-gauge HYPODERMIC NEEDLE and several GLASS VIALS. McMillan’s face turns white.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Think harder, Madame Secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning turns the corner, peers down the next corridor. It’s the scene of a MASSACRE. Dead Secret Service agents everywhere. Up ahead, the sound of distant VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black-clad commandos surround the two SUVs crashed into t main entrance hall. Cho barks orders in Korean. Banning warily peers around the corner. In the entrance hall, large MILITARY-STYLE CRATES are off loaded from the rear of the SUVs. POV BANNING: He can’t quite make out what they are. Cho issues more orders in Korean. The only word distinguishable to Banning is one -- “Cerberus”. Cho’s men load the crates into the freight elevator. The elevator doors close, and the lift begins to rise. Silently, Banning retreats.  43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang pulls the hypodermic from its case. Lim seizes McMillan from behind, holding her fast. The ot commandos level their MP-5s, cowing any would-be heroes.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Kang holds up one of the small vials.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Fuante Shi. One of the world’s most deadly orders of strychnine -- He fills the syringe with the vial’s contents. KANG (cont’d) -- no known antidote -- McMillan struggles, but Lim tightens her iron grip. Kang turns with the needle. KANG (cont’d) One more chance. Your Cerberus code. McMillan glances desperately at Asher. KANG (cont’d) He can’t help you. Asher and McMillan exchange a look. McMillan turns back t Kang, face firm with resolve. KANG (cont’d) There’s a saying in Korea -- “Listening 100 times is not as good as seeing it once.” Kang INJECTS her straight in the carotid.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: No!!! McMillan JERKS VIOLENTLY in her chair. Her eyes ROLL WILD body THRASHING. The hostages react, horrified. Finally, she goes still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not looking up, Kang methodically replaces the syringe in case as he calmly speaks.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Do you cry when your Predators scorch villages? When your “smart bombs” kill innocents from 60 miles away? Kang pushes a button on the control console. The door to PEOC LIVING QUARTERS -- adjacent to the main room -- slid OPEN. We catch a glimpse inside -- a half-dozen cots, kitchenette, supplies. Foreign Minister Lee lies dead on the first cot. Kang’s men drag McMillan’s body into the room -- and the CLOSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning moves down the silent corridor. More dead bodies down here. He kneels beside a fallen agent, turns him over -- IT’S ROMA Banning blinks, recognition dawning. He pulls the SHURIKEN from Roma’s forehead. Studies the exotic weapon briefly, then pockets it. Banning quickly searches Roma’s body. Already stripped of all weapons and communications gear. Gently, he closes Roma’s staring eyes. Distant FOOTSTEPS. Banning spins, head cocked. Someone’s coming. Quickly, he ducks into the near doorway. As around the corner --

dialogues.speaker: A TWO-MAN PATROL
dialogues.text: strides down the corridor. The commandos march forward, footfalls echoing. The larger commando suddenly stops, turning.  45. He bends over Roma’s body, fingers probing the open gash the man’s forehead... The shuriken is gone. The commandos both turn. Stare at the doorway through whi Banning just disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commandos burst inside. Flick on the lights. Two gleaming polished lanes, Presidential SEAL painted on far wall. Silent pins standing like sentinels. The killers scan the empty room, guns leveled, when

dialogues.speaker: A BOWLING BALL
dialogues.text: pops from the automatic ball return. The ball ROLLS slowly around the return carousel. Comes t rest against the rubber bumper with a thump. The commandos approach warily when

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: leaps from the transom above. Swinging a 12-pounder like sledgehammer -- he CRUSHES one commando’s skull. The second commando swings his weapon up. In a blur, Bann KNOCKS the gun away. He and the commando go down -- viciously GRAPPLING across the floor -- a furious FLURRY BLOWS. Banning drives his elbow up -- like a knife -- int the COMMANDO’S THROAT. The commando falters, stunned. Banning SPINS the commando against the ball rack -- grabs by the neck -- SLAMS his head into the stacked balls. Aga and again, body flooded with adrenaline and fear. The commando’s body slides to the floor, dead. Banning falls back, sucking air in great whooping gasps. He methodically searches the bodies. Grabs an MP-5 and wireless headset, clicks the unit on. Nothing but silence Banning looks up, mind racing.  46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malik steps beside Trumbull. Inserts a USB device into th computer console. A DIGITAL HEAD SHOT of Kang is projected onto the wallscr Bio-data scrolls below.

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: Yeonsak Kang. South Korean national, born in the North, birthdate unknown. Escaped across the DMZ as a child, both parents reportedly killed by ROK mines in the attempt -- A second PHOTO appears. Kang in military garb. MALIK (cont'd) Kang has served for the past six years in Seoul’s diplomatic protection corps, following two tours in South Korea’s elite Black Tiger counter-terror unit.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: So he knows what he’s doing -- Jacobs looks up.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: And clearly will stop at nothing to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Oval Office stands silent and empty. The door slowly swings open and

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: slips inside. He crosses to the presidential desk, rests his MP-5 on th blotter. A bank of PHONES sit mutely. Banning grabs the receivers, one after another. No dial tones. All dead.  47. He scans the desktop. Scattered papers, a Montblanc pen, ivory-handled letter opener -- THE PRESIDENT’S BLACKBERRY Banning grabs it. Punches 9-1-1. All lines are JAMMED. He can’t get through. Banning scowls, looks up. And his eyes go wide, as he’s utterly shocked to see

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: standing silently in the Oval Office doorway.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: (slowly) What are you doing here? Banning opens his mouth to speak when

dialogues.speaker: A COMMANDO
dialogues.text: steps through the side door. Connor spins and runs. Banning’s eyes jerk to his weapon. He’1ll never make it. commando raises his gun barrel and

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: grabs the letter opener. Flings it across the room. The blade spears the commando in the jugular. He falls, h clutching his throat. Banning grabs the MP-5. Races after Connor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor sprints down the hall. Banning gives chase. The bo disappears through an inner office doorway. Banning rushes up. Grabs the doorknob. Locked. He KICKS the door down.  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning bursts inside, eyes searching the small room. Des bookshelves, low filing cabinets. Connor is... gone. But that’s impossible. Banning stares, confused. He pulls out Asher’s BlackBerry. Scrolls down the listing Finds the one he wants... National Military Command Center. He dials. Lines still jammed. Dials again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trumbull presides over the somber room.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: What if this Kang is just some out- of-control rogue?

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: And if he’s not? He’s providing a hostile regime with the window of opportunity they’ve been seeking for the past sixty years -- His eyes flicker around the table. GALDARRES (cont’d) What will become of America’s credibility as a superpower, if we allow our ally to be overrun? Jacobs counters, angry.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: How will we be seen in the eyes of the world -- if we let our President be killed in his own goddamn house?! Jacobs’ AIDE rushes up, whispers urgently in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOBS (cont’d) (spins, to Trumbull) We have contact from inside the White House -- trace confirms it’s the President’s cell --

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: Patch it through. Feedback whine from the overhead speakers. TRUMBULL (cont’d) Mr. President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning slumps against the desk.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Identify yourself.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Echelon 4. Jacobs’ head jerks up.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: (low, to Jacobs) He’s one of yours -- ? Jacobs holds up her hand -- wait.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: (into intercom) Designator?

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Oscar-Zulu, three-zero-niner.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Banning? A stir races through the room.  50.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Yeah --

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: This is Director Jacobs --

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Where’s POTUS?

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: As of 1020 hours, the Fox Den. (quickly) The President and National Security team are being held by a North Korean named Kang. They’ve already killed Foreign Minister -- Trumbull snaps off the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: He’s a Special Agent --

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: Who should’ve been shitcanned two years ago -- Jacobs and Trumbull lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: He got in -- didn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lim triangulates the source of the cell transmission -- A DOT blinking on the wallscreen map of the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pak halts his men in their search through the building.

dialogues.speaker: KANG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (over headset) West Wing. First Floor. Pak grunts, leads his men quickly down the corridor.  51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacobs switches the intercom back on.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: Banning -- ?

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: What do they want?

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: The Seventh Fleet pulled -- by 2200 hours. BANNING (realizing what that means) You can’t do that --

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: Spare us the geopolitical advice, Agent --

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) What’s Cerberus? This stops Trumbull cold. The others share a look.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: What -- how did you -- ?

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: -- that’s classified --

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Kang knows. Their faces darken. Beat. Trumbull reluctantly nods to Jacobs.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: It’s a fail-safe protocol. Alpha Top Secret. But it has no offensive capability...  52.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: What kind of fail-safe?

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: Against inadvertent nuclear launch. The three Cerberus codes, when activated, control the self- destruct mechanisms within our ICBMs.

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: (realization dawning) With those codes -- Kang could destroy every long-range nuke we fire. With the Seventh Fleet pulled, South Korea would be defenseless.

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: And so would we. Their faces are tense.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: So change the codes --

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: No --

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: What do you mean, no --

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: He means we can’t. (beat) Cerberus is a self-contained total-isolation system. It’s unidirectional -- data only goes out, not in. The only way to change the codes is to physically do so on the computer itself.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Where’s the computer?

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: The PEOC. The enormity of the situation strikes home for them all.  53.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: The three codes -- who has them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang approaches Admiral Hoenig with his hypodermic needle Loads in a fresh vial.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Admiral. Your Cerberus code.

dialogues.speaker: HOENIG
dialogues.text: You don’t know what you’re doing --

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Don’t I? Kang looms over Hoenig, eyes black as anthracite. KANG (cont’d) I’m providing my nation with the opportunity to achieve its rightful destiny. Hoenig’s glance flickers to the syringe.

dialogues.speaker: HOENIG
dialogues.text: You’re not a patriot. (beat) You’re a psychopath --

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: I believe Seneca said it best -- “There is no genius without a touch of madness.” Kang places the point of the needle against Hoenig’s caro KANG (cont’d) Your code, Admiral. Kang’s finger tenses on the plunger. A beat of incredible tension.

dialogues.speaker: HOENIG
dialogues.text: (slowly) E-M-six... zero-eight... two-five. Kang lowers the syringe.  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pak and his men creep down the corridor. Pak listens to h tac-com, gets a fix on Banning’s exact location. He stops. Silently points to the NEXT OFFICE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commandos burst inside, FIRING ON FULL AUTO -- ASHER’S BLACKBERRY sits on the desktop. GETS BLASTED into a million pieces a bullets rake the room. Banning is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON WALLSCREEN: A SATCOM PHOTO of the post-attack Wh House.

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: All indications are the White House air defenses were destroyed in the attack. With this defense grid gone, they could be vulnerable to a nighttime aerial insertion --

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: And if you’re wrong? Malik steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: We have no choice. (beat) We’ve got to get the President out of there. We’ve got to secure Cerberus. All eyes turn to Trumbull. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: General, activate your team. Galdarres nods, grabs the hotline phone. Malik turns and exits the room. Pulls out his cell and presses it to his  55.

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: (low) Awaken the Sandman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning moves silently up the stairwell to the State Floo Turns the corner and

dialogues.speaker: TWO COMMANDOS
dialogues.text: stand watch on the landing. The killers and Banning see e other at the same instant. Banning’s reflexes are a millisecond faster. He MOWS DOWN both commandos with a burst from his MP-5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the blast of GUNFIRE, Pak barks into his tac-com.

dialogues.speaker: PAK
dialogues.text: (in Korean, subtitled) All units, State Floor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning races up the stairs, into the Cross Hall. A COMMANDO leaps from the near doorway, gun leveled. Banning dives into the Red Room, gunfire STITCHING the wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang speaks into his throat mic.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Mr. Cho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine floor just below the White House roof. Low HU of compressors. Cho stands beside a huge HYDRAULIC LIFT.  56.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: (into tac-com) Cho here.

dialogues.speaker: KANG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Is the package ready?

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: Almost there -- Cho goes back to his mysterious work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning runs for his life. Into the Blue Room. Bullets RA the walls, plaster fragments raining down. Banning looks up, dust stinging his eyes. A sober painting of GEORGE WASHINGTON stares down from th wall above. Banning and old George share a look. Warriors across time A barrage of machine gun slugs OBLITERATES the painting. Time to move. Banning dives behind a Louis XIV couch. A hail of bullets SHREDS it to ribbons. Banning hugs the floor -- bullets WHINING -- crawls quick toward the East Room when

dialogues.speaker: A COMMANDO
dialogues.text: steps into the doorway. Banning rolls as the commando fires, slugs STITCHING acro the hardwood. He swings his barrel up -- And BLASTS the gunman through the wall. Banning’s up fast. Into the East Room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning SPRAYS behind him, through the open doorway.  57. CLICK. He’s empty! He discards the useless MP-5. Eyes wildly searching.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BLUE ROOM
dialogues.text: Pak leads the commandos forward. Signals two men to rush East Room.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE EAST ROOM
dialogues.text: Banning grabs a bottle of gin from the liquor cart.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BLUE ROOM
dialogues.text: The two commandos move stealthily forward when

dialogues.speaker: A MOLOTOV COCKTAIL
dialogues.text: explodes through the doorway. Splashing fire ENGULFS both men. They spin across the room screaming, AFLAME.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE EAST ROOM
dialogues.text: Banning frantically lights two more bottles, HURLS them i the Cross Hall.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CROSS HALL
dialogues.text: Banning sprints into the corridor, ducking behind the wal flame. Wild gunfire ECHOES. The White House HALOCARBON FIRE-SUPPRESSION SYSTEM ACTIVA quickly neutralizes the spreading blaze. Banning races up the stairs to the Second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Second floor (living quarters) of the White House. Pak’s commandos converge from both ends. KICKING DOWN doo searching room by room. Relentless. Methodical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning crouches low in the Lincoln Bedroom, cornered.  58. No way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pak and his men close in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weaponless, Banning braces for the inevitable. Last stand When suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: THE WALL BEHIND HIM MOVES
dialogues.text: A large box molding square subtly shifts. Banning stares, incredulous, as

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: emerges from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: (whispers) Mike, hurry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pak looms outside the bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pak CRASHES inside, MP-5 SPRAYING the room. He blinks.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM IS EMPTY
dialogues.text: Pak stares, eyes flat. His tac-com crackles.

dialogues.speaker: KANG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Return to the bunker. Pak motions his men out. Scans the empty room one final t himself, then exits.  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pak’s men file into the elevator car. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the mainframe console, Lim controls the elevator’s descent. Kang hovers over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Initiate lockdown. Lim punches a button... Activating the full White House internal security grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throughout the Executive Mansion -- infrared, thermal, an motion sensor beams WINK ON. Crisscrossing every hallway, stairway and room in the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wallscreen subdivides into hundreds of VIDEO FEEDS -- monitoring every conceivable inch of the White House. No living thing can escape such technology. As soon as Banning moves, he’1ll be exposed. Kang’s eyes stay fixed on the wall of TV images. There is no place to hide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no place to hide. Except... Banning is being led by Connor through the walls. Ducking low -- shoulders barely squeezing through -- Bann follows the boy through the dim passageways.  60.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Always knew Truman gutted the interior in ‘49 -- new steel frame erected around the original stone walls -- Connor looks back, tight smile. A veritable tunnel rat. BANNING (cont’ d) -- but my God, Connor -- The kid spins, continues on. It’s literally a “house-within-a-house”. Secret corridors hidden doors. It would take literally weeks -- months -- figure out the whole of this bewildering labyrinth. Indeed the only one with the size, inclination, and time uncover the full extent of such a maze might be... An 8-year-old boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside, night has fallen. A commando steps onto the roof, loads what looks like a T GLIDER -- a Wasp III Micro Air Vehicle (MAV) drone -- ont slingshot, and LAUNCHES it into the sky. On silent wings, the Wasp circles up... circles up... and disappears into the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rotors whirring, the SEAL TEAM SIX choppers idle on the tarmac. Three stealth-modified BLACK HAWK troop carriers five APACHE LONGBOW gunships, fully armed. On the runway, the SEAL Team Six leader, MAJOR HOLT, 30s, greets Secret Service Agent O’Neil (recognizable from the Camp David opening). O’Neil wears a flak vest and helmet.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Agent O’Neil? O’ NEIL Major --  61. Both men turn for the command chopper.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: We’1l make sure you get in. You just get my men into that PEOC --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang scans the wallscreen images, perplexed. His eyes suddenly narrow.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Screen 26. Lim punches a button. VIDEO DISPLAY: The Lincoln Bedroom. KANG (cont’d) Quadrant four. Lim zooms in. KANG (cont’d) Enhance. Kang’s eyes focus on the far bedroom wall --

dialogues.speaker: THE BOX MOLDING IS SLIGHTLY OFF CENTER
dialogues.text: Kang thinly smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holt and his men check their weapons, ready for takeoff. A muscular BLONDE MAN suddenly sprints across the tarmac. Dressed in the same special ops gear as SEAL Team Six. He vaults into the open chopper door. This is the SANDMAN.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? Sandman looks up with piercing blue eyes. Hands Holt his orders.  62. Holt reads, glances up. He doesn’t like it, but turns and motions the chopper pilot. HOLT (cont’d) Take her up. O’Neil glances at Sandman. Sandman stares back, face a ma The choppers LIFT OFF. Baffled stealth ROTOR BLADES eeril making almost no sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning and Connor rest a moment, safe within the walls. boy eyes Banning -- filthy, exhausted, bleeding -- warily

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: You really saved my hide back there, partner. The boy shrugs. An awkward silence. Banning puts on the captured commando headset. Listens frowning. BANNING (cont’d) ...nothing... Connor looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Is my dad okay?

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (hesitates) I don’t know, buddy. The boy struggles to keep from crying. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: (re: headset) Can I see? Banning hands him the headset. Connor hunches over it, fiddling with the mute device. CONNOR (cont’d) (not looking up) When you left... you never said goodbye.  63. Banning swallows.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: I didn’t think you’d want me to. Connor reaches around. Slowly pulls something from his ba pocket --

dialogues.speaker: A BALL CAP
dialogues.text: The words “U.S. SECRET SERVICE” stitched across its front The boy snugs the cap firmly atop his head. Banning chokes up. Connor bends over the headset. His voice is very small.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: My dad says it was an accident. That it was no one’s fault... Banning swallows.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (hesitant) Is that what you think?

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Maybe no one could have saved her. Banning stares, numb. Awed by the simple pure forgiveness a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEAL Team Six en route. Locked and loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights out, rotors muffled, the stealth choppers SKIM ove the city. Passing over like phantoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mile above SEAL Team Six’s target --  64.

dialogues.speaker: AN RQ-170 SENTINEL DRONE
dialogues.text: circles above the White House, like a silent bird of prey stealth black batwing. CLOSE ON: The CAMERA EYE on the drone’s underbelly -- an ARGUS-IS 1.8 gigapixel electro-optic (EO) camera and infr imager. The unblinking eye stares down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A uniformed TECH turns from his monitor screen.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Sentinel’s on station, sir.

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: Give me eyes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sentinel’s night-vision EO camera WHIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the monitor screen, the ARGUS system’s real-time, high resolution image DISPLAYS.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: Visual up, sir. Galdarres studies the screen. The night-vision picture is perfect... The White House roof is empty, unmanned, unprotected.

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: Bastards will never know what hit ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning frowns, thinking.  65.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: (off Banning’s look) What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Just can’t figure it. Why they’re giving us twelve hours. They had to know it wouldn’t take anywhere near that to recall the Fleet -- His brow furrows. BANNING (cont'd) Why do they need more time? Connor shrugs, tinkering with the commando headset. BANNING (cont’d) (low, to himself) They have everything they need to access Cerberus... His mind works, feverishly trying to figure it out. BANNING (cont’d) (realization dawning) ...everything except... Banning slowly looks up -- at Connor. The headset suddenly SPUTTERS TO LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: I did it! Banning grabs the tac-com, puts it to his ear. And hears, impossibly, the FEEDBACK WHINE of another head unit directly behind him. Banning whirls and

dialogues.speaker: A COMMANDO
dialogues.text: launches himself out of the darkness, gun raised. Banning grabs the killer’s Glock. They CRASH into the wal The Glock fires, gunshot BOOMING in the confined space.  66. The commando forces the muzzle into Banning’s face. Banni JAMS his thumb inside the trigger guard -- preventing the gun’s discharge. The killer squeezes, pistol trigger CRUSHING Banning’s thumb. Grimacing, Banning presses the killer’s skull against the steel wall joist. Slowly -- inexorably -- the commando’s neck bends back. Banning pushes with every last ounce of leverage...

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (voice tight, to Connor) Look away --

dialogues.speaker: CRACK
dialogues.text: The killer goes still. Banning falls back, chest heaving. Connor looks up. Stares numbly at the lifeless corpse. Banning scrambles for the headset, puts it back on. Grabs the fallen Glock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEAL Team choppers streak in low over Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lim stares into a small MONITOR SCREEN, deftly working a toggle-like CONTROLLER. CLOSE ON SCREEN: POV of the Wasp III drone -- LOOKING DOW The stealth choppers approach, closing fast.

dialogues.speaker: LIM
dialogues.text: Here they come... Kang speaks into his throat mic. (NOTE: Banning hears all the following over his captured headset.]
