dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Mr. Cho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cho presses his hand against his earpiece.  67.

dialogues.speaker: CHO
dialogues.text: The package is ready.

dialogues.speaker: KANG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Stand by to repel boarders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning spins.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: The roof! Banning and Connor scramble down the dim passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cho presses a button on the control panel. Hydraulic gear WHINING, the lift platform begins to RISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning and Connor hurry through the narrow passages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEAL Team activates their night vision goggles. Lense glowing GHOSTLY GREEN.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Two minutes to target. O’Neil reaches up, flips his goggles ON. POV O’NEIL: The rooftops rush past below, crazily fast. A luminous wash of spectral green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy lift rising, Cho and his men race for the fire stai THREE COMMANDOS are left behind to stand guard.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning hears the grinding HYDRAULICS above. Quickly clim an interior wall ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two enormous metal doors slowly OPEN on the White House r Inside, the lift continues to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tech spins from his monitor.

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: We have movement on the roof, sir! Galdarres and the others stare at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEAL Team choppers flash over Georgetown.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Sixty seconds to target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunched low, Banning and Connor hurry down the dim passag directly below the roof sub-level. Banning stops, eyes searching. He sees an ancient (1930's era) metal ACCESS DOOR PANEL, encrusted with decades of rust and grit. Banning pulls on the door -- it opens with a stubborn SCREECH. Banning lif Connor, sets him inside the CRAWL SPACE within.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: I gotta get to the roof. Stay here -- okay? The boy nods, eyes afraid. Banning tweaks his cap, shoots him a reassuring look. He closes the door panel, Connor s behind it.  69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy machinery HUMS. A VENTILATION GRATE slowly opens in the floor and

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: peers out. The three commandos stand guard, facing away. Banning hoists himself up onto the floor. Silently moves forward, Glock raised -- The nearest commando’s eyes flicker. The commando whirls -- KNOCKING the Glock from Banning’s hand. He raises his own weapon and -- Banning’s hand flashes down -- SNAP! -- SHATTERING the commando’s forearm. Banning grabs the commando -- SPINS h to the ground -- lands on top -- twists -- SNAPS the commando’s neck. Banning ROLLS as -- the second commando -- still unslingi his weapon -- tries to get off a shot. Banning’s foot las out -- like a piston -- PULVERIZES the commando’s knee. H grabs the man -- lightning fast -- open palm driving up i the COMMANDO’S JAW. Spins him around just as the third commando starts FIRING -- The rounds THUD into the second commando -- body jerking KILLING him instantly. Banning uses the body as a shield HURLS the corpse into the third commando -- Banning and the third commando CRASH into the wall. Banni kicks out -- connects with the commando’s weapon -- the g goes flying. The two roll across the floor, furiously GRAPPLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lim stares into her small monitor screen. Continuing to w the toggle controller.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Ms. Lim --

dialogues.speaker: LIM
dialogues.text: Almost there...  70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sentinel drone continues its fixed surveillance patte Camera eye focused on the ground below. When, unseen, coming in silently from above --

dialogues.speaker: THE WASP DRONE
dialogues.text: swoops down, lands on the Sentinel’s back. Magnetic sucti like feet CLAMPING onto the larger drone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lim presses a button on her controller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SSSZZZPPP! The Wasp sends a massive ELECTROMAGNETIC PULSE coursing through the larger drone. The Sentinel instantly heels over and plummets from the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes fixed on the multiple wallscreen REAL-TIME VIDEO FEEDS. Following the assault via both the chopper-mounted CAMERAS and eye-in-the-sky drone. The Sentinel’s surveillance screen suddenly BLACKS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: What the --

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: The drone. What happened? The tech frantically works his controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning and the commando continue to viciously battle. Exchanging a savage, brutal series of hand-to-hand BLOWS. The commando SWEEP KICKS Banning off his feet. He pounces seizes Banning from behind -- grips him in a steel vise C HOLD.  71. Banning sags to his knees. Through bulging eyes, Banning sees the large crates lying open on the machine floor. Stenciled boldly across the si of the nearest one are the words...

dialogues.speaker: U.S. ARMY WEAPONS PROTOTYPE HYDRA SERIES 6A
dialogues.text: The lift continues to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone continues to stare at the BLANK surveillance dro screen. Faces tense.

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: We need that visual, corporal --

dialogues.speaker: TECH
dialogues.text: I’m trying, sir. An AIDE rushes up, hands Galdarres a file marked “CLASSIF

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: Crash report from the attack plane wreckage, sir. (talking fast) Report confirms this morning’s C-130 was armed with an M-111 VGL prototype --

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: The next generation of directed energy weapon. We call it the “Blind Bomb”. Effective range up to 2000 meters.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: How the hell did they get one of those? Galdarres rapidly flips through the report.  72.

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: (reading) Six months ago -- joint U.S.-South Korean experimental weapons testing -- a C-5A out of Osan Air Base went down in the Sea of Japan -- (keeps reading) -- reported lost were a VGL prototype and an Advanced Hydra Phalanx Weapons System -- Galdarres’ face goes white. GALDARRES (cont’d) (frantic) We need to abort -- He spins. Finger stabbing for the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the White House roof, the heavy lift CLANKS to a stop. The lift which originally housed the destroyed Avenger ai defenses. The lift upon which now sits...

dialogues.speaker: AN ADVANCED HYDRA PHALANX WEAPON
dialogues.text: The Hydra springs to life in a WHIR OF SERVOS. Six deadly barrels sweeping the sky, computerized targeting systems searching for prey. We have never seen anything like this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, out of nowhere --

dialogues.speaker: THE SEAL TEAM SIX CHOPPERS
dialogues.text: ZOOM UP AND OVER the Treasury Annex, rotors whirring. The Hydra reacts INSTANTLY, opening up with a CHAINSAW RO The two foremost choppers EXPLODE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holt bellows into his headset.  73.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: All birds! Evade! Evade! An armor-piercing ROUND drills Holt through the forehead. The SEAL Team Six leader is killed instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning struggles in the commando’s grip, face crimson. BITES DOWN on the commando’s knuckles, crunching bone. Th commando’s hold breaks. Banning flips him over his head. The commando spins -- up fast -- combat knife unsheathed. rushes Banning, SLAMS him into an electrical transformer. The commando dives atop Banning, throttling him. The gleaming blade bears down -- razored point an inch from Banning’s STARING EYE. With a final jerk -- Banning spins his attacker -- comman knife PLUNGING into the transformer’s exposed circuitry. Banning rolls away as 120,000 VOLTS SURGE through the met blade and into the commando’s body. The commando THRASHES WILDLY, turning black. Then goes still. Banning lunges to his feet, races for the control panel. finger STABS the lift button. Hydraulics whining, the lift begins to DESCEND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEAL Team choppers furiously juke. Chain guns and Hellfire missiles BLASTING AWAY. It’s a surreal sight. American combat choppers unleashing MISSILE BARRAGE on their own White House. The Hydra mercilessly RIDDLES another Black Hawk. The tro ship EXPLODES, incinerating all ten men aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Connor cowers inside the dark enclosed space. Eyes dartin as the GUNFIRE and EXPLOSIONS boom distantly above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lift continues to descend. Banning desperately wills to go faster.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Come on -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hydra’s guns swivel and FIRE, swivel and FIRE. Another Apache is RAKED. Rotors spinning, it SHEARS into Black Hawk beside it. Both choppers ERUPT in flame. The roof doors begin to CLOSE. Hydra rounds RICOCHET off heavy steel plates. The lift continues down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hydra rounds ricochet inside the closing steel doors. The din is DEAFENING. Banning sprints from the room. The doors continue to close. Hydra’s FURIOUS rate of fire never slowing. The bouncing, incendiary rounds WHIZ everywhere when

dialogues.speaker: A STRAY ROUND
dialogues.text: bores directly into the Hydra’s ammunition store. THE HYDRA ERUPTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blast practically LIFTS THE ROOF off the White House. Secondary EXPLOSIONS bloom, turning night into day. The last surviving SEAL Team chopper (Holt’s command ship swings in. Troopers rappel down. Cho and his men scramble onto the roof, FIRING. The SEALs are RIDDLED on their fast ropes, when --  75.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: leaps onto the roof -- grabs a discarded MP-5 -- guns dow onrushing commando.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BLACK HAWK COMMAND SHIP
dialogues.text: O’Neil furiously FIRES on the enemy below. Beside him, Sandman peers down his XM8 laser-sighted ASSAULT RIFLE.

dialogues.speaker: BLAM
dialogues.text: He drills commandos below with machine-like precision.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Cho fixes the Black Hawk’s tail rotor in his sights.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BLACK HAWK
dialogues.text: Sandman zeroes Cho. Finger on the trigger when

dialogues.speaker: A BURST OF GUNFIRE
dialogues.text: rakes both Sandman and O’Neil. Sandman falls from the ope chopper door.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Cho opens up on FULL AUTOMATIC, machine gun unleashing a murderous VOLLEY OF LEAD. The Black Hawk’s tail rotor DISINTEGRATES . The command ship pitches wildly, turbines SCREAMING their death throes. The chopper SLAMS into the White House roof Swinging SEALs fall to their deaths. O’Neil LEAPS from the dying bird. Fingers groping for purchase on the narrow roof ledge. The command ship plummets, CRASHING to the South Lawn bel EXPLODES in a blinding fireball. Banning riddles another commando -- vaulting the body bef it even hits the ground. He sprints forward -- tossing as his weapon and

dialogues.speaker: LUNGES
dialogues.text: for O’Neil. Grabs hold of the dangling man’s hand.  76. O’Neil hangs forty feet in the air. Banning’s grip the on thing between his fellow Secret Service agent and death. Their eyes meet. O’ NEIL Banning --

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Hold on. I’ve got you --

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Cho strides through the swirling smoke and flame. Straining, Banning cranes his neck around. Cho marches purposefully forward. Banning’s gaze flickers to his weapon, mere feet away. He’d have to let go of O’Neil. Cho stops and stands over Banning, eyes flat. Cocks his weapon. Banning is a dead man. Cho raises his barrel and

dialogues.speaker: A BULLET
dialogues.text: explodes through Cho’s throat. He falls dead. Banning spins and O’ NEIL stares up, looking past him. Smoking P229 in his hand. O’Neil slumps, pistol falling from his nerveless fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Total SILENCE. Connor listens in the still darkness. Tentative, he pushes open the access panel door. Squeezes out of the tiny crawl space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning strains to hold O’Neil’s dead weight.  77.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Give me your other arm -- O’Neil reaches up. Banning grasps his hand.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mike? Banning’s head swivels.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Connor wanders across the rooftop. Disoriented by the smo and swirling flame.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (croaks hoarsely) Connor! The boy stumbles blindly through the haze. Behind Connor, Pak and his men vault topside. Pak roughly grabs the boy.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Mike! On the far parapet, obscured by smoke, Banning lies unsee

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (weakly) Connor... He stares helplessly as Pak drags the boy away. Banning turns. And with the last of his strength, hauls O’Neil up onto the White House roof. O’Neil stares weakly, mouth twitching. O’ NEIL Always the cowboy... He coughs, gurgling blood.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Hold on, O'Neil -- The light fades from O’Neil’s eyes.  78. O’NEIL You shouldn’t... have left... the boy. He dies. Banning stares across the roof. A nightmare landscape of dead bodies, smoking debris, and flame. Connor is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang’s tac-com crackles. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: (into tac-com) Bring him to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the massive wallscreen, VIDEO FOOTAGE of the assault’s disastrous aftermath unfolds. Everyone stares in horror. The wallscreen flickers... and KANG’S FACE appears.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Mr. Trumbull -- Trumbull swallows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang stares, face implacable.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: You were warned. Kang turns, and in one smooth motion SHOOTS Vice Presiden Cardoza POINT BLANK IN THE HEAD. KANG (cont’d) Your President is next. Cardoza’s body slumps to the floor, dead.  79. KANG (cont’d) You now have one hour to recall the Seventh Fleet. When this is done, I want Marine One on the South Lawn fueled and ready. (beat) One hour. Kang terminates the transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The digital wall clock reads 9:48.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: (to Trumbull) We’ve got no choice. You have to recall the Fleet.

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: But, Mr. Speaker --

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: What do you propose, General? These people hold all the cards --

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: All but one. Everyone looks up. MALIK (cont’d) I took the liberty of dispatching an operative -- one of my own -- to go in with the General’s men.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: But the strike team was destroyed --

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: My asset was not.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: How can you be sure?

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: His bio-sensor’s still tracking. He’s alive.  80. Malik doesn’t blink. MALIK (cont’d) He’s never failed a mission. Trumbull turns to Jacobs.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: What about Banning? Could he still be -- Jacobs holds his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning leans against the low parapet. Bloodied, battered bruised. He stares through the drifting haze, and sees -- CONNOR’S BALL CAP blowing end over end across the debris-strewn roof. Banning reaches out. Clutches the crumpled cap in his fis He gazes down at the cap. The words “U.S. SECRET SERVICE” stare back. Like a beacon across time. Banning straightens. Reaches for O’Neil’s headset.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (into tac-com) -- Director -- do you copy -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning’s VOICE comes over the intercom. Everyone spins. Jacobs grabs the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: Banning!  81.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (matter-of-fact) They’re all dead. He grabs a weapon, checks the magazine.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Banning -- what -- what are you going to do? Banning strides across the roof, face a mask of resolve.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: My job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang pushes a button on the control console. The door to PEOC living quarters slides OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Admiral, you’1ll come with me -- Hoenig hesitates -- this is the room where the bodies of McMillan and Cardoza were all taken...

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: No, Nate -- A commando levels his weapon at Hoenig’s chest.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Admiral? On legs of stone, Hoenig stands and slowly crosses the PE Hesitantly steps inside the small room. Kang follows -- and the door CLOSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broken corpses sprawl across the still smoldering roof. Suddenly, one body MOVES. The figure stands amidst the sm and flickering flame --  82.

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN
dialogues.text: marches forward, like a machine. Pale eyes like ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive bunker door opens. Pak enters with Connor.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Connor! The boy runs to his father. ASHER (cont’d) Thank God... Kang roughly SPINS the boy by his arm. Looms over him, fa ominous.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Who’s been helping you? Connor stares back, defiant. Doesn’t answer. Asher pulls his son away, protective.

dialogues.speaker: LIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Got him. Kang turns, crosses to Lim at the control console. On her monitor screen, Lim replays surveillance video fro the machine floor. VIDEO FOOTAGE: A FIGURE surprises the three machine floor guards.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Freeze and process for face recognition. Lim FREEZE-FRAMES the figure’s face, ZOOMING in. Hits a button. HEAD SHOT PHOTOGRAPHS from the government’s full personne database cross-reference the image at blinding speed. The match frame appears. Banning’s ID photo.  83. KANG (cont’d) (reading) Michael Taylor Banning. First Recon Lieutenant -- Silver Star -- (beat, eyes widening) Current Secret Service -- demotion following death ruled accidental -- Margaret Louise Asher. Kang slowly turns -- and locks eyes with the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning peers down the long hall. Crisscrossed with motio sensor beams. There’s no way past. KANG’S VOICE (0.S.) (amplified) Mike Banning. Kang’s voice BOOMS over the White House intercom system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang studies the monitor screens intently.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Special Agent -- Mike Banning. Banning stays hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat of silence. And then...

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (shaky) Mike? This stops Banning in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: You have 30 seconds to show yourself, Agent Banning. Or I put a bullet in his eye. Banning leans back, closes his eyes.  84. KANG (cont’d) Fifteen seconds. We can tell from Banning’s face this is the hardest decis of his life. KANG (cont’d) Five. Banning leaves his weapon and O’Neil’s tac-com behind, mo into view. Lim’s monitor alarms suddenly TRILL. Banning walks down the corridor in full view, tripping th sensor beams. Unarmed, hands held high. Across the hall, the White House emergency elevator doors suddenly OPEN. Banning steps inside. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall clock continues its inexorable march. Time’s up. Trumbull hesitates. All eyes on him.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: (beat) Recall the Seventh Fleet. A wave of trepidation sweeps the room.

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: We’ve just cleared the way for the North Korean invasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alarms ECHOING, the emergency elevator doors OPEN. Banning stands inside the elevator car. Three COMMANDOS w outside for him, weapons leveled. The wall-mounted hallway CAMERA zooms in.  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secure in the PEOC, Kang watches the proceedings in the corridor outside on his monitor screen. CLOSE ON MONITOR: Hands raised, Banning steps from the elevator car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alarms suddenly SHUT OFF. Dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: KANG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (amplified) So this is our Silver Star. Kang’s disembodied VOICE echoes in the corridor. Banning looks up, stares directly into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang regards Banning’s defiant face on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: (into mic) I’m afraid failure seems to be quite the habit for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning stands helpless before the armed commandos. The lead commando’s tac-com crackles.

dialogues.speaker: KANG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered) Kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang watches the lead commando raise his weapon, when suddenly -- THE MONITOR SCREEN WHITES OUT.  86.

dialogues.speaker: PFFT
dialogues.text: The three commandos all drop as if POLE-AXED. Felled by pinpoint silenced rounds to the head. Banning jerks up and

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN
dialogues.text: peers down the barrel of his XM8 at the far end of the ha Sandman lowers his weapon, strides quickly forward.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: NSA.
dialogues.text: Sandman marches for the PEOC door. Banning grabs a weapon from a dead commando.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: The bunker’s sealed -- Sandman pulls a small REMOTE DEVICE from his web harness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the monitor screens are jagged with SNOWY INTERFERENC

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: What’s happening? Lim frantically works the controls, tries to restore the static-filled screens.

dialogues.speaker: LIM
dialogues.text: -- I’ve lost override -- The massive bunker door suddenly CHIMES. Pak and the othe commandos all spin, weapons leveled. Kang quickly steps behind the seated Asher, puts his gun the President’s temple. The titanium door slowly SWINGS OPEN.  87. SWIRLING HAZE from smoke grenades drifts in. We can’t see thing. Kang’s men train their weapons on the bunker entrance. Re to blow away anything the instant it appears. Seconds pass, seeming like hours. When suddenly

dialogues.speaker: A LASER BEAM
dialogues.text: bounces through the smoky haze.

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (neutral, robotic) Lower your weapons -— The pinpoint laser comes to rest squarely on Kang’s foreh Through the swirling smoke...

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN AND BANNING
dialogues.text: step into the bunker. Sandman keeps his XM8 trained on Ka Banning covers Pak and the other commandos.

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN
dialogues.text: -- nobody move --

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Mike!

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: It’s okay, partner -- Banning makes eye contact with Asher across the room. The two share a look.

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN
dialogues.text: Come with me, sir -- I’m getting you out of here --

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Not without the others. Sandman’s eyes imperceptibly flicker -- instantly taking the enemy weapons -- the number of hostages -- mind coldl calculating the odds. They’1ll never make it.  88.

dialogues.speaker: SANDMAN
dialogues.text: Those aren’t my orders.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: I’m not leaving without them -- Shockingly, Sandman’s laser dot moves from Kang’s forehea to Asher’s.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (to Sandman) -- the fuck -- Pak and his men raise their weapons -- Kang halts them. Sandman keeps his gun trained on the President. BANNING (cont’d) (to Sandman) What the hell are you doing? Asher stares at Sandman, eyes knowing.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: He knows exactly what he’s doing. Sandman stares down his weapon. ASHER (cont’d) He wasn’t sent to protect me. (beat) He was sent to protect Cerberus. Kang turns his weapon on Sandman. Banning shifts, takes d aim at Kang.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (to Sandman) Take your weapon off the President. Sandman doesn’t move. Laser dot steady on Asher. He knows Kang needs Asher alive -- needs Asher’s code. Would Sandman actually kill his own President in order to protect Cerberus? Kang and Sandman LOCK EYES. Both frozen like statues, neither moving a muscle. CLOSE ON SANDMAN: Face a stony mask, ice-blue eyes starin back at Kang, when...  89. ...the slightest twitch. BANNING (cont’ d) No! Kang FIRES, hitting Sandman -- Banning SIMULTANEOUSLY KNO SANDMAN’S BARREL UPWARD as the XM8 unloads on FULL AUTO - bullets BLASTING the wall just above Asher’s head -- Pak and the other commandos OPEN FIRE. The whole room ERU IN GUNFIRE, hostages DIVING FOR COVER. Banning spins, FIRING -- CUTS ONE OF THE COMMANDOS IN HAL Sandman is caught in the CROSSFIRE, BODY JERKING FROM THE HITS. He sprays on FULL AUTOMATIC -- taking out half the commandos in the room -- refusing to go down -- Asher PROTECTIVELY SHIELDS Connor with his body. Banning CUT OFF from them. He LUNGES for the President -- but Pak DRIVES HIM BACK with a WITHERING burst of fire. Sandman’s RIDDLED BODY falls to the ground, dead. The RELENTLESS GUNFIRE explodes around Banning. No choice He rolls -- FIRING -- DIVES through the bunker door, BULL WHINING. Pak LEAPS UP, takes off after Banning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning HAULS ASS down the corridor. CRASHES into the fir stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning checks his weapon. Half a clip left. He cracks the door. Cautiously peers out and

dialogues.speaker: A LINE OF SLUGS
dialogues.text: stitch the fire door, sparks FLYING. Pak advances down the hall, FIRING from the hip. Banning ducks back.  90. He looks up. The stairwell soars above him. Flight after flight, seeming to go forever. Banning races up the stairs. Behind him and below, the fire door SLAMS OPEN. Pak swiftly climbs, pursuing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang stands over Asher.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: So your protector fails you -- as he failed your wife -- Kang glances at Connor. KANG (cont’d) -- and your son -- Kang turns, kneels beside Sandman’s corpse. Pulls the sma remote from the dead man’s web harness. Kang flicks the switch. The monitor screens go back ON-LI He drops the device to the floor -- CRUSHING IT under his boot. Lim suddenly spins from the control console.

dialogues.speaker: LIM
dialogues.text: They’ re recalling the Fleet.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Was there ever a doubt? Asher glares at Kang.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: You just opened the door to Armageddon.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: No, Mr. President. You did.  91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning RACES up the endless flights, breathing hard. Pak relentlessly pursues. Banning peers down the stairwell. A burst EXPLODES past h face, bullets whining. Banning keeps climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang violently yanks Connor from his father.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Now, Mr. President -- He presses his gun to the boy’s temple. KANG (cont’d) Your code. Connor looks up, face filled with fear. Asher locks eyes with his terrified son. Kang COCKS his weapon. A long, excruciating beat.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: D-R-seven-two-five-six-nine. Kang releases the boy, triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: (into tac-com) All units. We’re leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throughout the White House, sentries abandon their posts race down the halls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asher glares at Kang, defiant.  92.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: But it’s no good to you -- Kang nods to his men, who sling black shoulder bags. ASHER (cont'd) -- without the codes of the Joint Chief’s Chairman and Defense Secretary, mine’s useless -- The commandos begin herding the hostages from the bunker. ASHER (cont’d) -- you murdered McMillan before she could -- Kang pushes a button on the control console. The door to PEOC living quarters slides open and

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY MCMILLAN
dialogues.text: is hauled back into the PEOC. Very much alive. McMillan’s eyes meet Asher’s. Asher’s face turns white.

dialogues.speaker: MCMILLAN
dialogues.text: Mr. President -- I’m sorry -- Asher gapes, dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: I lied -- there is an antidote -- if administered in time -- Asher’s eyes flicker past McMillan, into the small room. Foreign Minister Lee lies lifeless on the first cot. Vice President Cardoza dead on the second. Admiral Hoenig, THR BRUTALLY CUT, lies on the third. MCMILLAN (horrified, helpless) -- I thought -- Nate was killed because he refused -- McMillan is hauled away, through the bunker door. Asher stares in stunned disbelief. The last of the hostages are herded out. Asher, Connor, Kang, and Lim remain in the bunker.  93. Kang hands Lim his stainless steel briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: I’1ll see you shortly. Lim nods, heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: (to Kang) Please -- let my son go -- The massive bunker door CLANGS shut behind Lim, locking. Kang turns to Asher.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: We’re not finished yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hostages and captors file into the emergency elevator Lim thumbs the button, and the lift rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang stands before the control console, rapidly flips switches.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Initiation sequence activated. Please enter Cerberus codes. Kang enters the three codes. Upon entering the final one, the entire console WHIRS ALIVE. COMPUTER VOICE (cont’d) Cerberus is activated -- Cerberus is activated -- Asher looks on helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The North American Aerospace Defense (NORAD) command bunk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer mainframe LIGHTS UP like a Christmas tree. T head TECHNICIAN spins.

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Get the watch commander!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning bursts from the stairwell, chest heaving. Spins a races down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twin rotors throbbing, MARINE ONE -- a V-22 Osprey tiltro arrows toward the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning moves silently down the ground floor hall. Glance behind him, Pak nowhere in sight.

dialogues.speaker: PING
dialogues.text: At the far end of the hall, the elevator doors OPEN. The hostages and their captors rush from the car. Banning pulls back, eyes watchful. More commandos race up join those exiting the car. Some sort of rally point. Banning watches, unseen. Eyes searching for Asher and Connor.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: The commandos unsling their shoulder bags, unzipping them What looks like folded BLACK CLOTHING lays within. Lim reaches inside the elevator, punches a button on the control panel. The empty car DESCENDS. The commandos and hostages disappear around the corner.  95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive PEOC wallscreen configures into a huge digita map of the CONTINENTAL UNITED STATES.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: What’re you doing -- ? Kang flicks a switch. A dozen signal lights WINK ON acros the map. Nebraska, Colorado, South Dakota, upstate New Yo The entire NORAD missile defense grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ASHER (cont’d) -- we haven’t launched any missiles for you to self-destruct --

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Who said anything about waiting for their launch? (pause) I’m going to trigger them inside their silos. Asher’s face drains.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: (shocked) What the hell are you talking about?! But that means -- Kang smiles. ASHER (cont’d) (pleading) Listen, you wanted a unified Korea -- you're going to get it -- you don’t need to do this --

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: A unified Korea? (laughs) I’ve listened to that empty socialist palaver my entire life. Asher is stunned to his core. KANG (cont’d) No, Mr. President. That’s not why I’m here.  96. Kang turns, and kneels down before Connor. Stares directl into the boy’s eyes. KANG (cont’d) You know Connor, I watched my mother die too. Want to know how? (pause) The American mine... was hidden in the snow. It exploded -- I couldn’t hear a thing. Just this high-pitched buzz in my ears. I looked down and... I was covered with blood. My mother... her face was gone. Legs bloody stumps. Yet still -- she reached out for me -- as she bled out in the snow...

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Get away from him! Kang slowly rises. Turns to Asher, face a cold mask. KANG (matter-of- fact) The explosive force within each hardened bunker will detonate the warheads. Two hundred kilotons per missile, nominal yield. Tens of millions will perish in the resultant nuclear winter... your farm belt decimated for the next 250 years. A cold... dark... radioactive wasteland. Kang turns to the control console and flips the “ENABLE” switch. KANG (cont’d) Now too, America shall know famine and destruction. The console timer reads 8:00.00 and begins counting down. Eight minutes to Doomsday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marine One flares for a landing, twin rotors whirring.  97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COUNTER SNIPER MARKSMEN peer through Starlight nightscope Zeroing the South Portico.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Hercules Six, in position. POV NIGHTSCOPE: The South Portico square in the sniper’s crosshairs. When the commandos step outside, they’re dead men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a small window, Banning watches Marine One land o the South Lawn. From beneath the South Portico, the hostages and their captors slowly emerge onto the South Lawn...

dialogues.speaker: ALL DRESSED IDENTICALLY
dialogues.text: in black ski masks and rain ponchos. The indistinguishabl huddled group shuffles for Marine One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sharpshooters squint through their sniper scopes.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Hercules Six, do you have a shot?

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Negative. Targets unclear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning watches the huddled group shuffle for the tiltrot Mind racing. He raises his MP-5 and SMASHES the window pane. Triggers LONG BURST across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning’s line of slugs CHURN the grass.  98. It works. On instinct, the commandos REACT. Draw their weapons, searching for targets. The hostages duck like sheep. Now we know who the commandos are. The rooftop snipers OPEN FIRE. The commandos are mowed do like a scythe. The hostages race for Marine One. Banning’s eyes frantica scan the fast-moving figures... No one the size of Connor. Where is he? Where’s the President? McMillan and the other hostages dive aboard the tiltrotor Cowering against the whizzing bullets. Lim leaps aboard, clutching Kang’s briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE ONE PILOT
dialogues.text: I’m taking hits! Wheels up! Marine One takes off, turbines howling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang stands watching on the video monitor. VIDEO SCREEN: Marine One lifts off from the South Lawn. Kang pulls out a small TRIGGER DEVICE.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: No! Kang thumbs the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marine One EXPLODES over the South Lawn. Disintegrating i MASSIVE FIREBALL.  99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning stares in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LIVE NEWSFEED unfolds on the wallscreen. The gathered watch in disbelief as the tiltrotor DISSOLVES IN FLAMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang gazes at the monitor screen, pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning spins, races down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang presses a button on the control console and

dialogues.speaker: A HIDDEN STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: opens in the bunker floor. Kang turns to Asher and Connor, huddled against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Get up. Asher glares up in defiance. Kang reaches down and roughl hauls the President to his feet. Shoves him forward. Behind Kang, unseen, Connor’s eyes dart over the mainfram He reaches out, quickly hits a button. Asher and Connor share the briefest look. Kang spins, eyes narrowed. Grabs the boy, and pushes him his father down the metal stairway at gunpoint. And on the blinking control console behind them, the butt which Connor pressed is now illuminated. It reads... BUNKER UNSEALED.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON WALLSCREEN: Everyone stares in stunned silence a the burning wreckage that was Marine One. No one could have survived. Trumbull’s eyes move down the wallscreen -- to the LIVE M FEEDS of the escalating Korean crisis. VIDEO FOOTAGE: North Korean tanks and artillery rumble al the DMZ. Jet fighters zoom overhead.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: They’ re going to do it --

dialogues.speaker: GALDARRES
dialogues.text: Sir -- the President’s dead! Order the Fleet back! Across the room, Malik stands, hotline phone pressed to h ear.

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ -- Everyone spins. MALIK (cont’d) (looks up) Cerberus has been activated. Trumbull’s face blanches.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: What? But we haven’t launched a counterstrike -- A terrible beat. The realization of Kang’s true diabolica plan becomes clear.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: How many silos? Mailk puts the receiver down, face ashen.

dialogues.speaker: MALIK
dialogues.text: All of them. They exchange looks, faces frozen in utter horror.  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning races up. Retrieves O’Neil’s tac-com and the weap which he previously left in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (into tac-com) Director Jacobs --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning’s voice comes over the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: Banning!

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: I don’t think the President and Connor were on Marine One. They may still be alive -- The room BUZZES with the revelation.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: (talking fast) Listen, Cerberus has been activated! Kang’s going to detonate the ICBMs in their silos -- BANNING (stunned disbelief) What!

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: He’s going to kill us all. Banning is rocked. JACOBS (cont’d) You have to get in that bunker. It’s the only way to stop it -- Banning spins, mind racing. The emergency elevator. He sprints down the corridor.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang leads Asher and Connor below to the platform for the Subterranean Launch Evac Device (S.L.E.D.). An undergroun escape car, shaped like a small bullet train. A tracked tunnel leads into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning pries at the heavy emergency elevator doors. They won’t budge. He tries again, teeth clenched. Pulls with all his might. Slowly, the doors part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARMY RANGERS storm across the lawn of the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doors open, Banning unbuckles his belt. Rigs a crude harn and straps it onto the elevator cables. JACOBS’ VOICE (0O.S.) (over tac-com) There’s not much time -- Banning looks into the black shaft. It’s a long way down. He takes a deep breath... and steps into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The countdown monitor on the control console runs down. 2 minutes, 36 seconds remain.  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army Rangers burst into the White House. Re-secure th building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning lunges around the corner. Races down the corridor for the PEOC when

dialogues.speaker: PAK
dialogues.text: strides into the corridor from the far end. In one smooth motion, Pak levels his weapon and unloads o FULL AUTOMATIC. A withering burst of fire. Banning is DRIVEN BACK, around the corner. He reaches his MP-5 around the corner, SPRAYS blindly down the hall. Pak keeps advancing, furiously FIRING. Banning pulls the trigger. CLICK! Empty. Pak keeps advancing, FURIOUS RATE OF FIRE never slowing. Banning scrambles away, loses his tac-com. Pak turns the corner, BLASTS the headset to pieces. Banning is trapped. He’s a dead man. Pak raises his weapon for the killing burst -- Click. He’s dry too! Pak tosses the weapon. Pulls his COMBAT KNIFE. The thing looks like a fucking sword. Frantic, Banning gropes in his pants pocket. Pak advances down the hall -- frighteningly fast for a ma his size. He raises the knife and

dialogues.speaker: A SHURIKEN
dialogues.text: magically appears between his eyes. Pak sways unsteady, face confused. Then topples forward l a totem, dead.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The countdown monitor continues its inexorable march. 48 seconds to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning rushes up to the massive door to the PEOC bunker. Like the portal to the Underworld itself. The vault-like door is shut tight. Against all hope, Banning’s hand reaches for the door han He presses down on the latch. The door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang, Asher, and Connor get strapped into the evac car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning races inside. Lunges for the control console. 34 seconds remain. His eyes frantically search the myriad lights and switche He spies the button: “NATIONAL MILITARY COMMAND CENTER”. Banning punches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banning’s SWEATY FACE appears on the wallscreen.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: How do I stop it?

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: Find the control panel marked -- “COUNTERMAND” .  105. Banning’s eyes fly over the dials and toggles. 19 seconds left.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Got it!

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: Flip the blue-white switch marked “INITIATE RECALL”. Banning flips the switch.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Deactivation sequence initiated. Please enter abort command. The 16-character “ENTER CODE” field illuminates. 15 seconds remain.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (urgent) Give it to me --

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: (enunciating precisely) November-India-Lima-5- Sweat runs into Banning’s eyes. He blinks it away. 10... 9... 8... JACOBS (cont’d) Oscar-Hotel-backslash-niner- His fingers fly. Tie. 6... 5.0. JACOBS (cont’d) Victor-Kilo-underscore-hashtag- Banning doesn’t even breathe. 4... 3... 2... JACOBS (cont’d) Echo-7-Sierra-Foxtrot- The timers hits 00:00:00.  106.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Cerberus has been deactivated. Cerberus has been deactivated. Banning’s eyes flick to the open stairwell in the floor. Without hesitation, he races across the bunker. Vaults do the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kang initializes the launch sequence. Turns to Asher and draws his tanto (tactical Special Forces knife). Asher’s eyes go wide. The blade FLASHES DOWN -- -- and CUTS Asher’s zipcuffs. Kang presses the President’ palm to the translucent ID SQUARE on the car’s control pa

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER VOICE
dialogues.text: Welcome, Mr. President. The SLED’s engines ROAR TO LIFE. Banning races across the launch platform. Sprints after t escape car and

dialogues.speaker: LEAPS
dialogues.text: onto the rear of the SLED. Just as the escape car ROCKETS down the track. The SLED accelerates shockingly fast. SLAMS down the rail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trumbull scoops up the flashing hotline phone.

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: NORAD confirms. Cerberus has been shut down. Everyone can breathe again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The escape car SCREAMS forward, tracks a blur. Somehow, Banning holds on.  107. He ducks his head into the slipstream. And sees --

dialogues.speaker: THE TRACK JUST ENDS
dialogues.text: Up ahead, nothing but a wall of SOLID EARTH. The car SLAMS FORWARD at 80 MPH. Banning ducks down, suck air in short, rapid breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windscreen, the earthen wall rushes up. No ti to stop. Asher glares at Kang. Kang stares back, face impassive. He’s daring him. The black wall LOOMS like death itself. Asher glances one last time at Connor and then --

dialogues.speaker: REACHES OUT
dialogues.text: AND PRESSES his palm to the control panel ID square. The earthen wall EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Explosive bolts DETONATE, whole wall DISINTEGRATING into nothingness. The SLED rockets through the swirling debris, into the de of the Tidal Basin. An AVALANCHE OF WATER engulfs Banning The SLED zips underwater like a streaking torpedo. A homing beacon suddenly begins to DRONE. The SLED slowly rises, Banning holding on. The escape car continues to ascend. Banning’s face contor Been down too long. Need air. His torso writhes, burning lungs screaming... Banning lets go. He floats away, body disappearing into t murky depths.  108. The SLED keeps rising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The escape car surfaces, docking at an underground sewer substation. The main hatch OPENS. Kang prods Asher and Connor from the car with his gun. On the docking platform. Without warning -- Kang spins -- PISTOL WHIPS Asher acros the face. The President drops to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Dad! Kang looms over Asher.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mr. President -- Without ceremony, Kang points the pistol in Asher’s face

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY DIVES from the shadows -- TACKLING KANG to the ground. The pistol spins from Kang’s hand, across the ste platform. Kang spins away. The two men face each other, circling. Kang draws his tanto. Cat-quick -- Kang leaps forward -- razor-sharp blade flas A Ninjutsu master. The blade SLICES Banning’s arm. Asher grabs the FLARE GUN from the SLED. Aims at the two spinning, circling forms. No clear shot.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: (yells to Asher) Run! Asher hesitates. BANNING (cont'd) -- take Connor -- go! Asher grabs Connor’s hand. They race for the ladder.  109. Kang LUNGES -- and Banning grabs his knife hand. They SMA into the wall -- furiously grappling. Kang DRIVES a fist into Banning’s kidney. Banning grunts, nearly fainting. Kang leaps back. Connects with a SPIN KICK to Banning’s head. Banning FALLS. Kang LEAPS onto Banning, straddling him. Banning BLOCKS Kang’s fatal knife thrust -- but the blade bears down -- directly over Banning’s heart -- The two lock in a DEATH EMBRACE, but Kang has the advanta He BEARS DOWN harder. Banning struggles beneath him. Slowly -- inexorably -- the blade ARCS DOWN. The tip PIER Banning’s skin, drawing blood... When from the wall above, a telltale HISS. With the last of his strength, Banning pushes Kang’s face Directly in line with the recessed venting pipe --

dialogues.speaker: A SCALDING JET OF STEAM
dialogues.text: EXPLODES from the wall. The force of the BLAST blows Kang off Banning. The tanto goes spinning into the water. Kang staggers back, grimaci with rage and pain. He scrambles for his pistol across th platform. Banning LEAPS up, races for the substation ladder. Kang GRABS the pistol, whirls. FIRES wildly after Banning Banning climbs the ladder, bullets WHINING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An isolated, cordoned area on the banks of the Tidal Basi Yellow caution tape flutters. Asher and Connor climb from the access manhole. Banning scrambles from the manhole after them. Runs to th President and Connor, prods them forward.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: Come on! Connor looks back. And SCREAMS.  110. Banning whirls and

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: climbs from the manhole. He shambles forward, eyes burnin Like some demonic specter from Hell. Kang turns, and we see...

dialogues.speaker: THE LEFT SIDE OF HIS FACE
dialogues.text: is blistered BLACK. Ear, skin, hair, all gone. Asher raises the flare gun. Kang levels his own pistol at Connor.

dialogues.speaker: KANG
dialogues.text: (to Asher) Don’t be stupid -- Asher lowers the flare. Drops it in the grass. Banning’s eyes glance to the weapon. He just might make it. Banning stops himself. Looks from Asher to Kang. Kang crosses the recently-erected fireworks platform, mov in for the kill. KANG (cont’d) Annyong-hi kaseyo, Mr. President -- Kang levels his weapon at Asher.

dialogues.speaker: BANNING
dialogues.text: No! Kang pulls the trigger. Banning dives in front of Asher -

dialogues.speaker: TAKING THE BULLET
dialogues.text: Saving the President’s life. And giving Asher one crucial second. To grab the flare gun from the grass. Asher swings the weapon up, aiming wildly...  111.

dialogues.speaker: HE FIRES
dialogues.text: The flare misses. The projectile falls short, SIZZLING at Kang’s feet. Kang looks up. And with that horrific ghastly face... he smiles. A look pure evil. Kang raises his weapon to kill the President. When somewhere, in the dark recesses of his diabolical br something suddenly clicks. Kang’s eyes flicker for the briefest second --

dialogues.speaker: THE FLARE EXPLODES
dialogues.text: The whole fireworks platform upon which Kang stands liter ERUPTS. Detonating in a GIGANTIC FIREBALL. Kang just isn’t there anymore. The soaring fireworks rocket skyward, BOOMING. Vaporizing Kang into a million pieces. Asher helps Banning to his feet. Checks his wound.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: You okay? Banning nods, wincing. The two share a long look. A whirlwind of emotions pass between them. ASHER (cont’d) Thank you -- Asher pulls his son close, grateful. Banning’s eyes fill with sweet redemption.

dialogues.speaker: VOICES, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Over here! Army Rangers converge on Banning and the President from across the Mall.  112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the wallscreen, LIVE MEDIA COVERAGE of the continuing Korean crisis. Banner headlines read: “WAR APPEARS IMMINE VIDEO FOOTAGE: Massed TANKS AND ARTILLERY prepare to roll across the border. MOTORIZED INFANTRY itching to attack. The gathered all stare at the wallscreen, faces filled wi apprehension, when...

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: suddenly bursts into the room, flanked by Banning and Con Everyone leaps to their feet, astounded. The President is alive!

dialogues.speaker: TRUMBULL
dialogues.text: Mr. President, thank God!

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: Get Pyongyang on the line -- now. Everyone waits, expectant. The wallscreen flickers. The NORTH KOREAN PREMIER appears on the screen. Asher straightens. And for the first time since this whol nightmare began, he resumes his role as President and Commander-in-Chief. ASHER (cont'd) Mr. Premier, this is President Benjamin Asher. I hereby demand the immediate withdrawal of all combat divisions deployed along the DMZ in their current posture of imminent aggression -- The Premier stares back, face unreadable. ASHER (cont'd) If you do not accede to this request, you leave me no choice, in accordance with America’s mutual defense pact with the Republic of Korea, to act against you at once with the full might and fury of the United States arsenal --  113.

dialogues.speaker: PREMIER
dialogues.text: Mr. President. I assure you our military forces are merely engaged in war game exercise. This is our sovereign right -- Asher’s voice hardens.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: And this is my final request, Mr. Premier. I want your word you will stand down. (beat) Do I have it?

dialogues.speaker: PREMIER
dialogues.text: The Democratic Peoples Republic of Korea is a peaceable nation, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: (firm) Do I have your word? A long, excruciating beat.

dialogues.speaker: PREMIER
dialogues.text: You have it. The Premier’s face disappears from the screen. The entire Crisis Room EXPLODES in cheers and applause. Asher’s gaze flicks across the room -- and finds Malik. T two men share a LONG, PROFOUND LOOK. Malik blinks first, looks away. Jacobs slowly approaches Asher.

dialogues.speaker: JACOBS
dialogues.text: Mr. President -- She struggles for the words. JACOBS (cont’d) On behalf of the Secret Service... I want you to know, sir.. (faltering) I’m sorry.  114. Jacobs looks down. Nothing more to say.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: No need to apologize, Director. Asher glances at Banning. ASHER (cont’d) You had your best man on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dramatically backlit by searchlights, Army Rangers hoist American flag over the White House once again. The Stars and Stripes ripple in the breeze. The flag raising on Iwo Jima has nothing on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dignitaries and press assemble on the beautifully restore South Lawn.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER THE LEGEND
dialogues.text: President Asher addresses the nation from his podium.

dialogues.speaker: ASHER
dialogues.text: America has withstood many tests in her time. None more trying than this most recent adversity. But together as a nation -- and through the unflagging efforts of a courageous few -- America has once again proven that if we stand together -- that if we stand as one -- we shall always prevail. The gathered all rise in THUNDEROUS APPLAUSE. Connor beam proudly up at his father. Then he turns. And if the boy can beam even more proudly, does.  115. For standing behind them, in the unmistakable shades and coiled earpiece of the United States Secret Service Presidential Protection detail, is... MIKE BANNING. FADE TO BLACK.
